Title: TALLO'S $1,000 "DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION" SCHOLARSHIP
Description: As Tallo continues to work with colleges and companies who are prioritizing diversity and inclusion, know that your voice is a key component. We encourage you to share your experiences in this scholarship application but know that your responses will be completely anonymous. Be sure to follow us on Instagram at @AppTallo where we will announce the winner!

Title: $1,000 Easy Scholarship: Fill Out An Easy Pledge to Vote!
Description: You could win an easy $1,000 scholarship by filling out our easy pledge to vote this November. All you have to do is share why you plan on voting this fall. It takes less than 2 minutes! Fill out the online pledge form to automatically enter to win a $1,000 scholarship. Only applicable for 18 to 25 year olds. Let's Do This.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - Alabama
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: American Legion Auxiliary Scholarship Program
Description: A grant award to be used for tuition, fees and board expenses to attend a public postsecondary educational institution in Alabama. Awards are restricted to students who attend institutions having on-campus housing.

Title: Alabama National Guard Educational Assistance Program
Description: An award to be used for tuition, educational fees and book/supplies for Alabama National Guard members to attend a public postsecondary educational institution in Alabama.

Title: Alabama Scholarships for Dependents of Blind Parents
Description: An award to cover instructional fees and tuition at an Alabama state institution of higher learning for children from families in which the head of the family is blind and whose family income is insufficient to provide educational benefits.

Title: Alabama Student Assistance Program
Description: Need-based, state/federal grant ranging from $300 to $5,000 per academic year. Awards are limited to undergraduate work.

Title: Alabama Student Grant Program
Description: An award of grant assistance at an eligible independent Alabama college or university. Is not based on need. Up to $1200 per academic year with maximum amount available only when sufficient funds are available.

Title: Junior and Community College Athletic Scholarship Program
Description: An award not to exceed total tuition and books for attendance at public junior and community colleges in Alabama. Awards are based on demonstrated athletic ability determined through try-outs. Limits on various sports apply. Awards are not based on financial need.

Title: Junior and Community College Performing Arts Scholarship Program
Description: An award not to exceed in-state tuition only for attendance at public junior and community colleges in Alabama. Awards are based on demonstrated talent determined through competitive auditions. Awards are not based on financial needs.

Title: Police Officer's and Firefighter's Survivor's Educational Assistance Program
Description: A grant covering tuition, fees, books and supplies for dependents and eligible spouses of Alabama police officers and firefighters killed in the line of duty. There is no limit on the amount awarded to recipients. Awards are available for undergraduate study in public institutions in Alabama.

Title: Senior Adult Scholarship Program
Description: A free tuition program for senior citizens (persons aged 60 or over) who meet the admission requirements and attend public two-year postsecondary institutions in Alabama.

Title: Two-Year College Academic Scholarship Program
Description: An award not to exceed in-state tuition and books for attendance at public two-year postsecondary educational institutions in Alabama. Awards are based on demonstrated academic merit as determined by the institutional scholarship committee. Awards are not based on financial need.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - Alaska
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: Alaska Education Grant
Description: The Alaska Education Grant Program provides need-based financial assistance to eligible Alaska students attending qualifying institutions in Alaska. Grant awards range from $500 to $3,000 per academic year for students who have qualifying unmet financial need. A portion of funds is set aside for applicants with exceptional academic preparation and for those enrolled in workforce shortage programs. Students with the highest financial need are awarded in order of need until funds are exhausted.

Title: Alaska Performance Scholarship
Description: The Alaska Performance Scholarship is an invitation to excellence for Alaska's students, parents, and educators. To qualify, students must take a specific, rigorous high school curriculum; earn a minimum 2.5 GPA; and do well on a college or career-readiness exam. Three award levels are available.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - Arizona
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: $1,000 Private University Scholarships
Description: Monetary scholarships will be awarded to accounting students at private universities in Arizona for the 2017-2018 school year. The Arizona CPA Foundation Scholarship cannot be paid directly to the recipient. It will be paid to the university in which the recipient is to attend (checks are mailed in July).

Title: Arizona CPA Foundation High School Scholarship
Description: The Arizona CPA Foundation for Education and Innovation influences the choices of high potential students to enter the accounting profession in Arizona. It supports efforts of the Arizona Society of CPAs to attract and prepare individuals with the highest potential for contribution to the accounting profession in Arizona through initiatives in formal education. Two monetary scholarships will be awarded in the amount of $500 each if selected as a recipient and the requirements are met.

Title: Italian Catholic Federation
Description: This scholarship is for those living in within the Roman Catholic Dioceses of Arizona, California, Illinois and Nevada and a member of the Italian Catholic Federation.

Title: FBLA Arizona Scholarship
Description: The FBLA Arizona Scholarship is made available by various business partners and the Arizona chapter of Future Business Leaders of America. There will be ten winners of $1,000.00 each. The scholarships are not renewable and will be paid directly to your school of choice. The scholarship selection committee will focus on three main areas when selecting the scholarship winners: 1) FBLA participation and experience (50%), 2) impact on community (35%), and financial need (15%).

Title: Raise Me Wildcat Tuition Scholarship
Description: The Raise Me Wildcat Tuition Scholarship is an early outreach engagement pilot program, for a select number of Arizona high schools, encouraging high school academic improvement to assist students in preparing for college. Students enrolled in a participating high school will be notified of this opportunity.

Title: Ralph M. Knight Chemistry and Engineering Scholarship
Description: The Ralph M. Knight Chemistry and Engineering Scholarship is an award toward freshman-year tuition at a 4-year college or university in the U.S. Applicants must be full-time seniors attending a Catholic high school within the Diocese of Phoenix.

Title: Arizona Leveraging Educational Assistance Partnership
Description: The Arizona Leveraging Educational Assistance Partnership (AzLEAP) establishes a state and institutional partnership to provide student financial assistance in the form of need-based grants to low-income, undergraduate, Arizona resident students who have demonstrated substantial financial need, enabling students to attend postsecondary institutions in the State of Arizona.

Title: Jacques Avent Scholarship
Description: Established by the Central Arizona Chapter of the National Forum for Black Public Administrators to award scholarships valued up to $5,000 to future Black public administrators. The scholarship is named in honor of Jacques Avent, one of NFBPA's original founders. Jacques had a long distinguished public service career. He was the first African American to hold a senior executive position, serving as executive assistant to the City Council and Deputy City Manager with the city of Phoenix, Arizona. Through his trailblazing efforts, he was instrumental in promoting and increasing the number of African Americans in executive and middle management positions throughout the city. More importantly, Jacques served as a mentor and confidant to many CAC-NFBPA members and other city employees.

Title: Math, Science and Special Education Teacher Loan Forgiveness Program
Description: The Math, Science and Special Education Teacher Loan Forgiveness Program (MSSE) is a student-centered, need-based forgivable loan designed to financially support and to encourage Arizona resident junior or senior college students to enter into the teaching profession and teach in a public school in Arizona.

Title: $1,000 Easy Scholarship: Fill Out An Easy Pledge to Vote!
Description: You could win an easy $1,000 scholarship by filling out our easy pledge to vote this November. All you have to do is share why you plan on voting this fall. It takes less than 2 minutes! Fill out the online pledge form to automatically enter to win a $1,000 scholarship. Only applicable for 18 to 25 year olds. Let's Do This.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - Arkansas
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: Student Undergraduate Research Fellowship
Description: Designed to allow undergraduate students to conduct in-depth research projects in their specific fields of study with the assistance of faculty mentors.

Title: Governor's Distinguished Scholarship
Description: The Governor's Distinguished Scholarship is the most academically rigorous scholarship program offered for those graduating seniors scoring either 32 on the ACT or 1410 on the SAT, and a 3.50 academic grade point average. Those who are named National Merit Finalists or National Achievement Scholars may qualify without meeting the GPA requirement, but must still meet the ACT/SAT requirement. The scholarship pays tuition, mandatory fees, room and board up to $10,000 per year.

Title: Arkansas Health Education Grant (ARHEG)
Description: ARHEG provides financial assistance to students seeking professional training in chiropractic medicine, dentistry, optometry, osteopathic medicine, podiatric medicine, and veterinary medicine to allow them to attend out-of-state institutions.

Title: Higher Education Opportunities Grant (GO! Grant)
Description: Provides $1000 grants to full-time and $500 grants to part-time students based on financial need. Student must be an Arkansas resident for at least 12 months prior to applying for the grant. Student also must meet the financial need criteria established for the GO! Grant and attend an approved Arkansas institution. Applicants complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) and the GO! Opportunities Grant application.

Title: Law Enforcement Officers' Dependents Scholarship
Description: LEO provides a waiver of tuition, fees, and room at any public college, university, or technical institute in Arkansas for dependents and spouses of Arkansas law enforcement officers, some Highway and Transportation Department employees, and other public employees, who were killed or permanently disabled in the line of duty.

Title: Military Dependent Scholarship
Description: MDS provides a waiver of tuition, fees, room and board at any public college, university, or technical institute in Arkansas for dependents and spouses of Arkansans who were killed or missing in action or who were prisoners of war or who are totally and permanently disabled.

Title: Out-of-State Veterinary Medical Education Loan Repayment Program
Description: The Out-of-State Veterinary Medical Education Loan Repayment program will assist with repayment of federal student loans for up to five (5) years for eligible veterinarians that attended Mississippi State University College of Veterinary Medicine and practice food supply veterinary medicine within the State of Arkansas.

Title: Second Effort Scholarship
Description: Up to $1000 annually to the individuals with the top 10 scores on the GED exam during the previous calendar year.

Title: Teacher Opportunity Program (TOP)
Description: TOP offers reimbursement grants to current Arkansas teachers and administrators seeking to further their education. Teachers and administrators may apply for reimbursement for out-of-pocket expenses paid for up to six (6) college credit hours completed for an academic year, not to exceed $3000.

Title: State Teacher Education Program (STEP)
Description: STEP is a loan reduction program that offers yearly loan repayment grants to current educators teaching in a subject or geographic shortage area in an Arkansas public school. Teachers must reapply each year and are eligible for up to three years.

Title: Academic Challenge Scholarships
Description: The Academic Challenge Program provides scholarships to Arkansas residents pursuing a higher education. Funded in large part by the Arkansas Scholarship Lottery, the Academic Challenge Scholarship is available to students regardless of their academic status, whether just graduating from high school, currently enrolled in college, enrolling in college for the first time, or re-enrolling after a period of time out of college.

Title: Single Parent Scholarship
Description: Single Parent Scholarships (SPSF) are given to low-income single parents who are pursuing post-secondary education in preparation for skilled employment. Scholarship Funds are administered by affiliate organizations and volunteers in each county of Arkansas. Eligibility criteria and application requirements vary by county. To apply for a scholarship or to get involved, contact the affiliate SPSF serving the county you live in.

Title: Washington Center Scholarship
Description: A program that awards scholarships of up to $6000 to Arkansas students who are accepted to The Washington Center for Internships and Academic Seminars located in Washington, D.C.

Title: Workforce Improvement Grant (WIG)
Description: WIG awards up to $2000 annually to students at least 24 years old based on financial need. Students apply using the Free Application for Federal Student Aid and awards are made by the institution the student attends. Students may be enrolled part time.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - California (Making Waves)
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - Northern California
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - Southern California
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: Latinos in Technology Scholarship
Description: The Latinos in Technology Scholarship was established by the Hispanic Foundation of Silicon Valley, a public foundation dedicated to inspiring community philanthropy and engaging people to invest in the educational achievement and leadership development of a thriving Hispanic community in Silicon Valley. This program will give 100 Latino students the support they need to graduate from college, an educational opportunity they would not have access to otherwise. By implementing this program in Silicon Valley, HFSV will be able to directly address the local education gap among Latinos as well as begin to close the high tech employment diversity gap.

Title: Italian Catholic Federation
Description: This scholarship is for those living in within the Roman Catholic Dioceses of Arizona, California, Illinois and Nevada and a member of the Italian Catholic Federation.

Title: California National Guard Education Assistance Award Program
Description: If you are an active member in the California National Guard, the State Military Reserve, or the Naval Militia you may be eligible for a state-funded program designed to provide an educational incentive to improve your skills, competencies, and abilities.

Title: Bobette Bibo Gugliotta Memorial Scholarship for Creative Writing
Description: For students majoring in the creative writing field and who have demonstrated creative writing ability.

Title: Cal Grant Competitive Award
Description: For students who are not eligible for the Cal Grant Entitlement awards.

Title: California Chafee Grant for Foster Youth
Description: If you are or were in foster care and have financial need, you may qualify for up to $5,000 a year for career and technical training or college. You don't have to pay this money back. You may also be able to use your grant to help pay for child care, transportation and rent while you're in school. You can use your Chafee Grant at any eligible California college or university or career or technical school, as well as schools in other states.

Title: Child Development Grant Program
Description: The Child Development Grant Program (Program) is a need-based grant designed to encourage students to enter the field of child care and development in a licensed children's center.

Title: Krishnan Shah Scholarship
Description: This scholarship program seeks to support financially needy students with academic potential and demonstrated community involvement, and provide meaningful and ongoing financial support to ensure that students complete their undergraduate degree.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - Southern California
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: Latinos in Technology Scholarship
Description: The Latinos in Technology Scholarship was established by the Hispanic Foundation of Silicon Valley, a public foundation dedicated to inspiring community philanthropy and engaging people to invest in the educational achievement and leadership development of a thriving Hispanic community in Silicon Valley. This program will give 100 Latino students the support they need to graduate from college, an educational opportunity they would not have access to otherwise. By implementing this program in Silicon Valley, HFSV will be able to directly address the local education gap among Latinos as well as begin to close the high tech employment diversity gap.

Title: Re-entry Woman Scholarship
Description: Scholarships are awarded to women who are non-traditional students who have experienced challenges in life and education that differ from the traditional 4-year path. Applicants must be 23 years of age or older. Must live or attend school in north San Diego County, including northern city of San Diego.

Title: Italian Catholic Federation
Description: This scholarship is for those living in within the Roman Catholic Dioceses of Arizona, California, Illinois and Nevada and a member of the Italian Catholic Federation.

Title: California National Guard Education Assistance Award Program
Description: If you are an active member in the California National Guard, the State Military Reserve, or the Naval Militia you may be eligible for a state-funded program designed to provide an educational incentive to improve your skills, competencies, and abilities.

Title: Bobette Bibo Gugliotta Memorial Scholarship for Creative Writing
Description: For students majoring in the creative writing field and who have demonstrated creative writing ability.

Title: Cal Grant Competitive Award
Description: For students who are not eligible for the Cal Grant Entitlement awards.

Title: California Chafee Grant for Foster Youth
Description: If you are or were in foster care and have financial need, you may qualify for up to $5,000 a year for career and technical training or college. You don't have to pay this money back. You may also be able to use your grant to help pay for child care, transportation and rent while you're in school. You can use your Chafee Grant at any eligible California college or university or career or technical school, as well as schools in other states.

Title: Child Development Grant Program
Description: The Child Development Grant Program (Program) is a need-based grant designed to encourage students to enter the field of child care and development in a licensed children's center.

Title: Krishnan Shah Scholarship
Description: This scholarship program seeks to support financially needy students with academic potential and demonstrated community involvement, and provide meaningful and ongoing financial support to ensure that students complete their undergraduate degree.

Description: In an effort to raise awareness of career opportunities in the mental health field to members of our communities, Centennial Mental Health Center is pleased to offer its eighth annual Future Mental Health Professional Scholarship Program. Title: Sylvia M. Young Smith Scholarship

Title: Colorado Graduate Grant
Description: The Colorado Graduate Grant is a need based program offering assistance to students enrolled in a graduate program.

Title: Colorado National Guard Tuition Assistance Program
Description: Pays up to 100% of tuition costs at state supported institutions, for its members. For more information, contact a National Guard recruiter or the state tuition assistance office at (303) 677-8913.

Title: Colorado Student Grant
Description: The Colorado Student Grant is a need based grant offered to students enrolled at least half time in a degree- or certificate-seeking program.

Title: Dependent Tuition Assistance Program
Description: Pays tuition, on-campus room and board for dependents of Colorado law enforcement officers, fire or national guard personnel killed or disabled in the line of duty, and for dependents of prisoners of war or service personnel listed as missing in action.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - Connecticut
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: Acacio "Roger" Rodrigues Memorial Scholarship
Description: Established by the Rodrigues family, in memory of Acacio "Roger" Rodrigues, scholarships will be awarded to graduating high school seniors who reside in Dutchess, Putnam or Westchester County, New York or Fairfield County, Connecticut and who plan to study in a field which will lead to a career in the building/construction industry. These fields include but are not limited to architecture, engineering, construction management, electrical construction technology, plumbing and heating, welding and fabrication, etc. The scholarships will be awarded to individuals who are or will be full time students at any accredited vocational school, college or university in the United States.

Title: Governor's Scholarship - Academic Incentive Award
Description: Offers a Connecticut resident who has completed 30+ credits in the prior year, received a Governor's Scholarship Need-Based Award, and in good academic standing up to $1,200 for full time study.

Title: Governor's Scholarship - Need-Based Award
Description: Offers a Connecticut resident who attends a CT public or non-profit, private college up to $3,000 for full time study in a 2 or 4 year program.

Title: Meland Foundation Nursing Scholarship
Description: The Meland Foundation grants funding for scholarships to nurses in the NJ-NY-CT-PA area with BSN degrees wishing to pursue Nurse Practitioner degrees with a pediatric specialty and who share the vision of the Foundation. The Meland Foundation founded by a beloved pediatrician who built a successful family medical practice in Northern New Jersey provides and supports inspirational and informational programs to enhance the ability of families to care for loved ones and to provide hope to patients and their caregivers.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - Florida
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: Arts for Life! Scholarship
Description: Arts for Life! annually awards $2,000 scholarships to 25 graduating high school seniors in Florida who demonstrate excellence in creative writing, dance, drama, music or visual art.

Title: Rosewood Family Scholarship
Description: The Rosewood Family Scholarship Program was created to provide student financial assistance for a maximum of 50 eligible students who attend a state university, Florida college (public community college), or public postsecondary vocational technical school. Eligible students must be direct descendants of Rosewood families affected by the historical incidents of January 1923.

Title: Scholarships for Children and Spouses of Deceased or Disabled Veterans
Description: The Scholarships for Children and Spouses of Deceased or Disabled Veterans (CSDDV) provides an award to dependent children or un-remarried spouses of qualified Florida veterans.

Title: Stephanie Nicole Ross Foundation Graduate Scholarship
Description: SNRF welcomes applications for our 2019-20 scholarship award. Three $1,000 scholarships will be awarded to graduate students studying psychology, cognitive and behavioral science, or any related field at a college or university in the state of Florida in 2019-2020. Previous SNRF scholarship awardees are encouraged to apply for additional funding.

Title: Bright Futures Scholarship Program
Description: The Florida Bright Futures Scholarship Program establishes three lottery-funded scholarships to reward Florida high school graduates for high academic achievement.

Title: Access to Better Learning and Education Grant Program
Description: The Access to Better Learning and Education (ABLE) Grant Program provides tuition assistance to Florida undergraduate students enrolled in degree programs at eligible private Florida colleges or universities.

Title: First Generation Matching Grant Program
Description: Available to degree-seeking, resident, undergraduate students who demonstrate substantial financial need, and are enrolled in eligible participating postsecondary institutions. Eligible students have a parent(s) who has not earned a baccalaureate or higher degree.

Title: Florida Incentive Scholarship Program
Description: The Florida Incentive Scholarship Program is a merit scholarship for 2013-14 Florida high school graduates and thereafter who receive recognition as a National Merit or National Achievement Scholar. Eligible scholars will receive an award, which is equal to the institutional cost of attendance minus the sum of Bright Futures and the National Merit/Achievement award. An initial application is not required.

Title: Florida Student Assistance Grant Program
Description: The Florida Student Assistance Grant (FSAG) Program is a need-based grant program available to degree-seeking, resident, undergraduate students who demonstrate substantial financial need and are enrolled in participating postsecondary institutions.

Title: Florida Work Experience Program
Description: The Florida Work Experience Program (FWEP) is a need-based program providing eligible Florida students work experiences to complement and reinforce their educational and career goals.

Title: Fort Lauderdale Alumnae Panhellenic Scholarship
Description: Fort Lauderdale Alumnae Panhellenic is proud to provide scholarships that reflect the organization's belief in the development of character through service and high academic achievement. The scholarship offers educational support for those with strong academic track records and a desire to help others. They stand for service through the development of character inspired by the close contacts and deep friendships of individual Fraternity and Panhellenic life. The opportunity for wide and wise human services, through mutual respect and helpfulness, is a tenet by which we strive to live.

Title: Mary McLeod Bethune Scholarship Program
Description: The Mary McLeod Bethune Scholarship (MMB) provides financial assistance to undergraduate students who meet scholastic requirements, demonstrate financial need, and attend Bethune-Cookman University, Edward Waters College, Florida A&M University, or Florida Memorial University. Each participating institution determines application procedures, deadlines, and student eligibility.

Title: Minority Teacher Education Scholarship - Florida Fund for Minority Teachers, Inc.
Description: The Minority Teacher Education Scholarship (MTES) program is a collaborative performance-based scholarship program for African-American, Hispanic-American, Asian-American, and Native American students administered by the Florida Fund for Minority Teachers, Inc. (FFMT).

Title: William L Boyd, IV, Florida Resident Access Grant
Description: The William L. Boyd, IV, Florida Resident Access Grant (FRAG) Program provides tuition assistance to Florida undergraduate students attending an eligible private, non-profit Florida college or university. Each participating institution determines application procedures, deadlines, and student eligibility.

Title: Tripp Family Fund for Educational Opportunity Scholarship
Description: In 1994, Broward County attorney Norman Tripp and his family established this scholarship to help women in transition achieve their educational goals. This full scholarship can be applied to tuition, books and fees. To be eligible, applicants must be a "woman in transition," defined as a woman whose life experiences have led her to want to obtain her bachelor's degree in order to significantly better her professional opportunities. This includes but is not necessarily limited to: divorced or widowed women, women abandoned by their husbands, domestic violence survivors, and single mothers. Applicants must be a current Broward College student who will begin attending Florida Atlantic University (FAU) in the Spring 2017 term with the intent of completing a bachelor's degree (2+2 degree program), and must enroll and remain a full-time student at FAU (minimum 12 credits per semester), demonstrate financial need, have a cumulative GPA of 2.5 at Broward College, be a U.S. citizen, and be a resident of Broward County. Scholarship covers a maximum of 15 credits per semester.

Title: William L Boyd, IV, Florida Resident Access Grant
Description: The William L. Boyd, IV, Florida Resident Access Grant (FRAG) Program provides tuition assistance to Florida undergraduate students attending an eligible private, non-profit Florida college or university. Each participating institution determines application procedures, deadlines, and student eligibility.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - Georgia
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: Georgia Military College State Service Scholarship
Description: Georgia Military College (GMC) State Service Scholarship Loan Program is a service cancelable loan program created to provide outstanding students with a full two-year scholarship loan. The student must agree to serve in the Georgia National Guard for a period of four years to complete service repayment (two years while attending GMC and two years after graduation).

Title: Georgia Public Safety Memorial Grant Program
Description: Public Safety Memorial Grant provides assistance to the dependent children of Georgia public safety officers who were permanently disabled or killed in the line of duty. Funds may be used toward the cost of attendance at eligible colleges or universities in Georgia.

Title: Helping Educate Reservists and their Offspring (HERO) Scholarship
Description: Helping Educate Reservists and their Offspring (HERO) Scholarship provides assistance to members of the Georgia National Guard and U.S. Military Reservists, their children and spouses, who were deployed overseas on active duty service, on or after February 1, 2003, to a location designated as a combat zone.

Title: HOPE Scholarship
Description: The HOPE Scholarship (Helping Outstanding Pupils Educationally) provides scholarship aid to Georgia residents attending a HOPE eligible college or university who maintain at least a 3.0 GPA. Most Georgia Colleges are eligible and award amounts vary by school and are typically between $1,000 and $4,000 per semester for full-time students.

Title: John R Justice Prosecutors and Defenders Incentive Act of 2008
Description: The John R. Justice Prosecutors and Defenders Incentive Act of 2008 was passed by Congress to encourage qualified individuals to enter or continue employment as prosecutors and public defenders. The Georgia Student Finance Authority (GSFA) is the designated state agency responsible for administering this program. Applicants applied to GSFA based on the programmatic criteria set forth by the United States Department of Justice (USDOJ).

Title: Scholarship for Engineering Education (SEE) Service Cancelable Loan
Description: Scholarship for Engineering Education (SEE) Program provides financial assistance to Georgia residents attending an eligible private postsecondary institution and enrolled in an engineering program of study approved by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of the Accrediting Board of Engineering and Technology (ABET). The purpose of the program is to attract and grow the number of qualified engineers in Georgia. In return, students agree to work for a period of time after graduation in an engineering-related field in Georgia.

Title: Scholarship for Engineering Education for Minorities Service Cancellable Loan Program
Description: Created in 2015, MSEE is a service cancelable loan available to upperclassmen at eligible state colleges that can be used for tuition, room and board, or other educational expenses. In return, students agree to work in Georgia after graduation in an engineering-related field for a reduction in the loan's balance.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - Georgia
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: Georgia Military College State Service Scholarship
Description: Georgia Military College (GMC) State Service Scholarship Loan Program is a service cancelable loan program created to provide outstanding students with a full two-year scholarship loan. The student must agree to serve in the Georgia National Guard for a period of four years to complete service repayment (two years while attending GMC and two years after graduation).

Title: Georgia Public Safety Memorial Grant Program
Description: Public Safety Memorial Grant provides assistance to the dependent children of Georgia public safety officers who were permanently disabled or killed in the line of duty. Funds may be used toward the cost of attendance at eligible colleges or universities in Georgia.

Title: Helping Educate Reservists and their Offspring (HERO) Scholarship
Description: Helping Educate Reservists and their Offspring (HERO) Scholarship provides assistance to members of the Georgia National Guard and U.S. Military Reservists, their children and spouses, who were deployed overseas on active duty service, on or after February 1, 2003, to a location designated as a combat zone.

Title: HOPE Scholarship
Description: The HOPE Scholarship (Helping Outstanding Pupils Educationally) provides scholarship aid to Georgia residents attending a HOPE eligible college or university who maintain at least a 3.0 GPA. Most Georgia Colleges are eligible and award amounts vary by school and are typically between $1,000 and $4,000 per semester for full-time students.

Title: John R Justice Prosecutors and Defenders Incentive Act of 2008
Description: The John R. Justice Prosecutors and Defenders Incentive Act of 2008 was passed by Congress to encourage qualified individuals to enter or continue employment as prosecutors and public defenders. The Georgia Student Finance Authority (GSFA) is the designated state agency responsible for administering this program. Applicants applied to GSFA based on the programmatic criteria set forth by the United States Department of Justice (USDOJ).

Title: Scholarship for Engineering Education (SEE) Service Cancelable Loan
Description: Scholarship for Engineering Education (SEE) Program provides financial assistance to Georgia residents attending an eligible private postsecondary institution and enrolled in an engineering program of study approved by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of the Accrediting Board of Engineering and Technology (ABET). The purpose of the program is to attract and grow the number of qualified engineers in Georgia. In return, students agree to work for a period of time after graduation in an engineering-related field in Georgia.

Title: Scholarship for Engineering Education for Minorities Service Cancellable Loan Program
Description: Created in 2015, MSEE is a service cancelable loan available to upperclassmen at eligible state colleges that can be used for tuition, room and board, or other educational expenses. In return, students agree to work in Georgia after graduation in an engineering-related field for a reduction in the loan's balance.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - Illinois
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: Illinois National Guard Grant Program
Description: If you are a member* of the Illinois National Guard, you may be eligible to receive the Illinois National Guard (ING) Grant. This grant can pay for eligible tuition and certain fees (i.e., registration, graduation, general activity, matriculation and term fees) for undergraduate or graduate study.

Title: Illinois Special Education Teacher Tuition Waiver (SETTW) Program
Description: If you are a teacher or an academically talented student pursuing a career in special education as a nonprofit public, private or parochial preschool, elementary or secondary school teacher in Illinois, you may be eligible for the Illinois Special Education Teacher Tuition Waiver Program.

Title: Minority Teachers of Illinois (MTI) Scholarship Program
Description: If: 1) you plan to teach at a nonprofit Illinois public, private, or parochial preschool, elementary school, or secondary school, for which the Illinois State Board of Education (ISBE) has determined that no less than 30 percent of the enrolled students are African American/Black, Hispanic American, Asian American, or Native American; and 2) you are of African American/Black, Hispanic American, Asian American or Native American origin, then you may qualify for up to $5,000 per year as part of the Minority Teachers of Illinois (MTI) Scholarship Program.

Title: Italian Catholic Federation
Description: This scholarship is for those living in within the Roman Catholic Dioceses of Arizona, California, Illinois and Nevada and a member of the Italian Catholic Federation.

Title: Golden Apple Scholars of Illinois
Description: The Golden Apple Scholars of Illinois Program encourages academically talented Illinois students, especially minority students, to pursue teaching careers, especially at high-need, hard-to-staff schools by providing tuition assistance at one of the participating colleges.

Title: Grant Program for Dependents of Correctional Officers
Description: If you are the spouse or child of a State of Illinois Department of Corrections officer who was killed or became at least 90 percent disabled in the line of duty, you may be eligible for the Grant Program for Dependents of Correctional Officers.

Title: Grant Program for Dependents of Police or Fire Officers
Description: If you are the spouse or child of an Illinois police or fire officer who was killed or became at least 90 percent disabled in the line of duty, you may be eligible for the Grant Program for Dependents of Police or Fire Officers.

Title: Higher Education License Plate Program
Description: The Higher Education License Plate (HELP) Program provides grants to students who attend Illinois colleges for which the special collegiate license plates are available. The Illinois Secretary of State issues the license plates, and part of the proceeds are used for grants for undergraduate students attending these colleges.

Title: James Hunter Anthony & Gerald E Blackshear Endowment
Description: This scholarship is for incoming freshman who have graduated from an Illinois high school.

Title: Monetary Award Program
Description: The Monetary Award Program (MAP) provides grants, which do not need to be repaid, to Illinois residents who attend approved Illinois colleges and demonstrate financial need, based on the information provided on the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA). You are not required to submit high school grades or test scores when applying for a MAP grant.

Title: Nursing Education Scholarship
Description: If you are pursuing a certificate in practical nursing, an associates degree in nursing, a hospital-based diploma in nursing or a bachelor's or graduate degree in nursing and demonstrate the greatest financial need among qualified students, you may be qualified to win the Nursing Education Scholarship.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - Indiana
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: Fort Wayne Indiana Scholarship Program
Description: The Ft. Wayne Indiana Scholarship Program is designed to assist students in Fort Wayne, IN or Allen County.

Title: Freshmen Art Scholarship
Description: Incoming USI Freshman art or art education majors who are residents of Indiana or qualify for the IN-KY Reciprocal Tuition Program, and who submit a completed application by the first Friday in February are eligible for these scholarships.

Title: Indiana University Health Neighborhood Scholarship
Description: The Indiana University Health Neighborhood Scholarship provides a renewable, need-based 4 year scholarship for graduating high school seniors from the Northwest and Mid-North neighborhoods of Indianapolis, IN (eligible zip codes: 46202, 46205, and 46208).

Title: UNCF Far Eastside of Indianapolis Scholarship
Description: The UNCF Far Eastside of Indianapolis Community Scholarship Program provides up to $3,000 in need-based scholarship awards to selected applicants who are permanent residents of the Far Eastside of Indianapolis Community (Zip codes: 46235, 46236, 46229, 46226, 46218 and 46219).

Title: Adult Student Grant
Description: The Commission offers an adult student grant program to undergraduate students to assist returning adults to start and complete their Associate or Baccalaureate degrees or Certificates by subsidizing part-time tuition costs.

Title: Child of Deceased or Disabled Veterans
Description: The Commission offers a supplement to other state grants by guaranteeing 100% of tuition and regularly assessed fees for children of disabled veterans.

Title: Children and Spouse of Indiana National Guard
Description: The Commission offers a supplement to other state grants by guaranteeing 100% of tuition and regularly assessed fees for students who are the child or spouse of a member of the Indiana National Guard who suffered a service connected death while serving on state active duty.

Title: Children and Spouse of Public Safety Officers
Description: The Commission offers a supplement to other state grants by guaranteeing 100% of tuition and regularly assessed fees for students who are children and spouses of certain Indiana public safety officers (PSO) killed in the line of duty or permanently disabled state troopers.

Title: Frank O'Bannon Grant
Description: The Frank O'Bannon Grant is designed to provide access for Hoosier students to attend eligible postsecondary institutions. It receives its funding through appropriations made by the Indiana General Assembly.

Title: Indiana Purple Heart Recipient
Description: The Commission offers a supplement to other state grants by guaranteeing 100% of tuition and regularly assessed fees for students who are Indiana veterans who are Purple Heart Recipients.

Title: Mitch Daniels Early Graduation Scholarship
Description: The Commission offers a one-time grant for students who graduate from a publicly supported high school at least one year early.

Title: Soldiers' and Sailors' Children's Home
Description: The Commission offers a supplement to other state grants by guaranteeing 100% of tuition and regularly assessed fees for students who are former students and/or graduates of Morton Memorial High School and former residents of the Indiana Soldiers' and Sailors' Children's Home (ISSCH).

Title: Student Teaching Stipend for High-Needs Fields
Description: Stipend for students planning to teach in a high-need field. The Commission defines high-need as middle or high school level math, science or special education.

Title: Student Teaching Stipend for Minorities
Description: Stipend for minority students (defined as black and Hispanic individuals) who will participate in student teaching as part of the students' degree requirements.

Title: William A. Crawford Minority Scholarship
Description: The Commission offers scholarships for minority students (defined as black and Hispanic individuals) planning to teach in an accredited school in Indiana upon graduation. Student must agree in writing to apply for a teaching positions Indiana and, if hired, teach in Indiana for at least three years.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - Iowa

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - Nebraska & Western Iowa
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: All Iowa Opportunity Foster Care Grant
Description: Students who age out of Iowa's foster care system, age out of the Iowa state training school or who are adopted from Iowa foster care after the age of 16 may qualify for the All Iowa Opportunity Foster Care Grant program.

Title: All Iowa Opportunity Scholarship
Description: The All Iowa Opportunity Scholarship (AIOS) is a state-funded scholarship program for students who do well in high school and demonstrate financial need.

Title: Robert D. Blue Scholarship
Description: The Robert D. Blue Scholarship, named after the former Iowa governor, provides funds ranging from $500 to $1,000 to Iowa students who demonstrate literary and scholastic ability; exhibit qualities of truth, courage, and fellowship; and display moral force of character.

Title: Education and Training Voucher Grant
Description: The Education and Training Voucher (ETV) Program provides awards of up to $5,000 per year to students who age out of foster care and students who are adopted after age 16.

Title: GEAR UP Iowa Scholarship
Description: The GEAR UP Iowa Scholarship provides awards of up to $600 per year to students who are part of the GEAR UP Iowa state-wide cohort. Scholarships are sent directly to the college/university that the student is attending and can be used to pay for tuition/fees, room/board, books/supplies, and personal/living expenses while in college.

Title: Governor Terry E Branstad Iowa State Fair Scholarship
Description: The Governor Terry E. Branstad Iowa State Fair Scholarship recognizes outstanding Iowa high school seniors who have actively participated in the Iowa State Fair.

Title: Iowa Barber and Cosmetology Arts and Sciences Tuition Grant
Description: The Iowa Barber and Cosmetology Arts and Sciences Tuition Grant is available to assist Iowa residents attending participating Iowa barber and cosmetology colleges.

Title: Iowa National Guard Educational Assistance Grant
Description: The Iowa National Guard Educational Assistance Grant (NGEAP) provides annual awards to Iowa National Guard members who attend eligible Iowa colleges and universities.

Title: Iowa Tuition Grant
Description: Iowa Tuition Grants are awarded to Iowa residents enrolled at one of Iowa's eligible private colleges and universities.

Title: Iowa Vocational-Technical Grant
Description: Iowa residents enrolled in career or technical education programs at Iowa community colleges may be eligible to receive this grant.

Title: Kibbie Grant (Iowa Skilled Workforce Shortage Tuition Grant)
Description: Iowa residents enrolled in specified career or technical education programs at Iowa community colleges may be eligible for this grant program.

Description: The All Iowa Opportunity Scholarship (AIOS) is a state-funded scholarship program for students who do well in high school and demonstrate financial need.

Title: Robert D. Blue Scholarship
Description: The Robert D. Blue Scholarship, named after the former Iowa governor, provides funds ranging from $500 to $1,000 to Iowa students who demonstrate literary and scholastic ability; exhibit qualities of truth, courage, and fellowship; and display moral force of character.

Title: Education and Training Voucher Grant
Description: The Education and Training Voucher (ETV) Program provides awards of up to $5,000 per year to students who age out of foster care and students who are adopted after age 16.

Title: GEAR UP Iowa Scholarship
Description: The GEAR UP Iowa Scholarship provides awards of up to $600 per year to students who are part of the GEAR UP Iowa state-wide cohort. Scholarships are sent directly to the college/university that the student is attending and can be used to pay for tuition/fees, room/board, books/supplies, and personal/living expenses while in college.

Title: Governor Terry E Branstad Iowa State Fair Scholarship
Description: The Governor Terry E. Branstad Iowa State Fair Scholarship recognizes outstanding Iowa high school seniors who have actively participated in the Iowa State Fair.

Title: Iowa Barber and Cosmetology Arts and Sciences Tuition Grant
Description: The Iowa Barber and Cosmetology Arts and Sciences Tuition Grant is available to assist Iowa residents attending participating Iowa barber and cosmetology colleges.

Title: Iowa National Guard Educational Assistance Grant
Description: The Iowa National Guard Educational Assistance Grant (NGEAP) provides annual awards to Iowa National Guard members who attend eligible Iowa colleges and universities.

Title: Iowa Tuition Grant
Description: Iowa Tuition Grants are awarded to Iowa residents enrolled at one of Iowa's eligible private colleges and universities.

Title: Iowa Vocational-Technical Grant
Description: Iowa residents enrolled in career or technical education programs at Iowa community colleges may be eligible to receive this grant.

Title: Kibbie Grant (Iowa Skilled Workforce Shortage Tuition Grant)
Description: Iowa residents enrolled in specified career or technical education programs at Iowa community colleges may be eligible for this grant program.

Fill out the online pledge form to automatically enter to win a $1,000 scholarship. Only applicable for 18 to 25 year olds. Let's Do This.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - Kansas
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: Kansas Comprehensive Grant
Description: The Kansas Comprehensive Grant is a need-based grant available to Kansas residents enrolled full-time at eighteen private colleges and universities located in Kansas, the six state universities, and Washburn University.

Title: Kansas Career Technical Workforce Grant
Description: The purpose of this grant program is to encourage individuals to further their education and provide the benefit of their employment to the State of Kansas to assist in the development of a strong state workforce in high demand, critical industry employment fields.

Title: Kansas Ethnic Minority Scholarship
Description: The Kansas Ethnic Minority Scholarship program is designed to assist financially needy, academically competitive students who are identified as members of any of the following ethnic/racial groups: African American; American Indian or Alaskan Native; Asian or Pacific Islander; or Hispanic.

Title: Kansas Military Scholarship
Description: Candidates who served in any overseas military operation after 9/11/2001 for which they received hostile fire pay are eligible to submit the State of Kansas Student Aid Application with a copy of their DD-214 form or active duty orders.

Title: Kansas Nursing Service Scholarship
Description: The Kansas Nursing Service Scholarship is designed to encourage enrollment in nursing programs by Kansans committed to practicing as a LPN or RN in Kansas.

Title: Kansas Optometry Service Scholarship
Description: Designed to encourage optometrists to establish Kansas practices. Kansas helps to pay the difference between resident and nonresident tuition at eligible out-of-state institutions.

Title: Kansas Osteopathic Medical Service Scholarship
Description: Designed to encourage primary care physicians to establish practices in rural areas of Kansas.

Title: Kansas Teacher Service Scholarship
Description: This service obligation scholarship program provides financial assistance to both students pursuing bachelor's degree programs and currently licensed teachers pursuing endorsement in hard-to-fill disciplines or master's degrees in hard-to-fill disciplines or either group planning to teach (K-12) in an underserved geographic area in Kansas.

Title: Kansas Dental Education Opportunities
Description: Designed to encourage dentists to establish Kansas practices. Kansas helps pay the difference between resident and nonresident tuition at the University of Missouri-Kansas City.

Title: Kansas Distinguished Scholarship Program
Description: Created to encourage Brasenose, Clevening, Fulbright, Madison, Marshall, Mellon, Rhodes and Truman scholars from Kansas to continue graduate studies at Kansas public universities.

Title: Kansas Nurse Educator Service Scholarship
Description: Designed to encourage graduate level nursing students who agree to teach in a nurse education program at a Kansas postsecondary educational institution.

Title: Kansas ROTC Service Scholarship
Description: Student agrees to accept a commission as a Second Lieutenant and serve for not less than four years as a commissioned officer in the Kansas Army National Guard.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - Kentucky
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: Coal County Scholarship Program for Pharmacy Students
Description: This scholarship provides financial aid to Kentucky residents who plan to work as pharmacists in coal-producing counties in the state.

Title: Mary Jo Young Scholarship
Description: This scholarship provides financial aid to Kentucky resident enrolled in dual credit courses at a Kentucky college.

Title: Osteopathic Medicine Scholarship
Description: The Osteopathic Medicine Scholarship Program provides financial aid to Kentucky students pursuing a degree at the Kentucky College of Osteopathic Medicine at the University of Pikeville.

Title: College Access Program Grant
Description: CAP Grants help Kentucky's financially needy undergraduate students attend eligible public and private colleges and universities, proprietary schools, and technical colleges.

Title: Early Childhood Development Scholarship
Description: The scholarship provides financial aid to Kentucky students pursuing a degree or certificate in child development.

Title: Go Higher Grant
Description: Need-based Go Higher Grants give students age 24 or older up to $1,000 for one academic year when they enroll in a participating Kentucky college less than half-time, which is usually one or two courses.

Title: Kentucky Coal County College Completion Scholarship
Description: The Kentucky Coal County College Completion Scholarship provides financial assistance for residents of Kentucky's coal-producing counties to complete their first bachelor's degree.

Title: Kentucky Educational Excellence Scholarship
Description: The KEES program provides scholarships to students who earn at least a 2.5 GPA each year they attend a certified Kentucky high school.

Title: Kentucky Tuition Grant
Description: These grants provide need-based aid to help Kentucky residents attend eligible Kentucky private colleges.

Title: Minority Educator Recruitment and Retention Scholarship
Description: This scholarship provides financial aid to Kentucky residents who are minority teachers.

Title: Teacher Scholarship
Description: The Teacher Scholarship Program provides financial aid to Kentucky students pursuing initial teacher certification at participating Kentucky colleges.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - Louisiana
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: Chafee Educational and Training Voucher
Description: The Chafee Educational and Training Voucher (ETV) Program awards up to $5,000 annually during the academic year to qualified students who have been in the foster care system so they can pursue an academic college education or technical and skill training in college to be prepared to enter the workforce. The actual award amount is determined by the student's financial need, which is calculated in accordance with the Higher Education Act of 1965, as amended.

Title: Go Grant
Description: The purpose of this program is to provide a need-based component to the state's financial aid plan to support nontraditional and low to moderate-income students who need additional aid to afford the cost of attending college.

Title: Louisiana GEAR UP
Description: A federally funded national initiative, LA GEAR UP (Louisiana Gaining Early Awareness and Readiness for Undergraduate Programs) is supported by the U.S. Department of Education, which gives grants to states or institutions of higher learning to create partnerships with high-poverty middle or high schools.

Title: Rockefeller State Wildlife Scholarship
Description: The Rockefeller State Wildlife Scholarship is a competitive scholarship that awards $2000 annually for an undergraduate student and $3,000 annually to a graduate student pursuing a degree in forestry, wildlife or marine science at a Louisiana Public College or University. The cumulative maximum award is $12,000 for up to three years of undergraduate study and two years of graduate study.

Title: TOPS Program
Description: TOPS (Taylor Opportunity Program for Students) is a program of state scholarships for Louisiana residents who attend either one of the Louisiana Public Colleges and Universities, schools that are a part of the Louisiana Community and Technical College System, Louisiana approved Proprietary and Cosmetology Schools or institutions that are a part of the Louisiana Association of Independent Colleges and Universities.

Title: TOPS Tech Early Start Program
Description: The TOPS Tech Early Start award provides up to $600 per academic year for any eligible 11th or 12th grade student attending a Louisiana PUBLIC high school who wishes to concurrently enroll for up to six credit hours per semester in order to pursue certification in an Eligible Program at a public or nonpublic college or an approved training provider.

Title: Volunteer Fireman's Tuition Reimbursement
Description: The Safer Tuition Reimbursement Grant is sponsored by the Louisiana State Firemen's Association (LSFA). The program provides tuition reimbursement for up to $8,000 for a two year degree and up to $16,000 for a four year degree for eligible applicants who sign up to serve as volunteer firemen in the State Louisiana after graduation.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - Maine
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: Doctors for Maine's Future Scholarship
Description: The Doctors for Maine's Future Program provides scholarships for eligible medical students who enroll in a qualifying Maine-based medical school program. Currently, Tufts University School of Medicine Maine Medical Center Program and the University of New England College of Osteopathic Medicine participate in the Doctors for Maine's Future Scholarship Program.

Title: Educators for Maine Program
Description: The Educators for Maine Program is a competitive, merit-based, forgivable loan program for Maine students pursuing careers in education or child care and planning to work in Maine after graduation.

Title: State of Maine Grant Program
Description: The State of Maine Grant Program provides need-based grants to Maine undergraduate students.

Title: Tuition Waiver Program (Public Servant)
Description: Children or spouses of Maine firefighters, law enforcement officers or emergency medical services providers killed in the line of duty may receive a tuition waiver to a participating Maine public college/university.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - DC, Maryland, Virginia
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: Charles W. Riley Firefighter and Ambulance and Rescue Squad Member Scholarship Program
Description: The Charles W. Riley Firefighter and Ambulance and Rescue Squad Member Scholarship Program encourages members of the fire-fighting, ambulance, and rescue organizations serving Maryland communities to pursue credited courses that lead to a degree in fire service technology, emergency medical technology, fire service management, or public safety administration with a minor or concentration in fire service technology or fire service management.

Title: Delegate Scholarship
Description: This scholarship provides current high school seniors and full-time or part-time degree-seeking undergraduate or graduate students with financial assistance.

Title: Educational Assistance Grant
Description: This scholarship provides assistance to current high school seniors and full-time, degree-seeking undergraduates.

Title: Howard P Rawlings Guaranteed Access Grant
Description: This scholarship provides financial assistance to Maryland residents enrolling in a 2 or 4 year Maryland college or university.

Title: Senatorial Scholarship
Description: This scholarship provides current high school seniors and full-time or part-time degree-seeking undergraduate or graduate students with financial assistance.

Title: Jack F Tolbert Memorial Student Grant Program
Description: This scholarship provides students attending or who plan to attend a private career school with financial assistance.

Title: 2+2 Transfer Scholarship
Description: The 2+2 Transfer Scholarship is designed to assist and encourage transfer students from Maryland community colleges to attend a 4-year institution within the State. Students must be enrolled in an eligible accredited Maryland postsecondary institution.

Title: Graduate and Professional Scholarship Program
Description: This scholarship provides degree-seeking graduate and professional students with financial assistance.

Title: Part-Time Grant
Description: This scholarship provides part-time, degree seeking undergraduates and students dually enrolled in a Maryland high schools and an institution of higher education with financial assistance.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - Massachusetts
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: Massachusetts High Demand Scholarship Program
Description: The Massachusetts High Demand Scholarship Program was created by the Massachusetts Legislature to support economic growth and development. The purpose is to encourage degree completion in high demand disciplines that will help address the workforce needs of the Commonwealth by providing scholarship assistance to support the educational costs of students pursuing such programs of study. The application for the Massachusetts High Demand Scholarship is open to community college students who are pursuing a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Math) degree.
Fields of study: Agriculture, Astronomy/Astrophysics, Biology, Chemistry, Computer Science, Earth Science/Geology, Engineering, Information Technology, Physics, Pre-Medicine, Psychology

Title: Christian A. Herter Memorial Scholarship Program
Description: The Christian A. Herter Memorial Scholarship Program was established in 1972 by the Massachusetts State Legislature to recruit students in the 10th and 11th grades whose socio-economic backgrounds and environmental conditions may inhibit their ability to attain educational goals. The students that are selected for this program must have overcome major adversity in their lives (i.e. physical or mental abuse, catastrophic illness, etc.). Obstacles may be mental, physical, geographic, or societal.

Title: GEAR UP Scholarship
Description: Gaining Early Awareness and Readiness for Undergraduate Programs (GEAR UP) is a federal program designed to provide early intervention services and programs to students in middle school and high school. The mission of GEAR UP is to significantly increase the number of low-income students who are prepared to enter and succeed in postsecondary education. MICHIGAN GEAR UP (MI GEAR UP) targets low-income students in the state of Michigan providing them with support services to increase their opportunity to succeed in higher education at Michigan's higher educational institutions.

Title: John and Abigail Adams Scholarship
Description: The John and Abigail Adams Scholarship is a merit-based program that provides a tuition waiver for up to eight semesters of undergraduate education at a Massachusetts state college or university. For this scholarship, merit is based on student scores on the 10th grade Massachusetts Comprehensive Assessment System (MCAS) test.

Title: Paul Tsongas Scholarship
Description: The Paul Tsongas Scholarship is a merit-based program that rewards Massachusetts students with a grade point average (G.P.A.) of 3.75 and highly competitive Scholastic Aptitude Test (S.A.T.) scores of at least 1200 (or the American College Testing [A.C.T.] equivalent). Eligible students receive a waiver of tuition and mandatory fees at a Massachusetts state university. Each of the nine (9) Massachusetts state universities may provide five new Paul Tsongas Scholarship Program Tuition Waivers per academic year.

Title: Communication Disorder / Speech Therapy Scholarship
Description: Up to $500 for graduate study in Communication Disorder or Speech Therapy.

Title: GFWC of Massachusetts Education - Teaching Scholarship
Description: Applicant must be a senior in a Massachusetts high school or home schooled and has achieved the standards for graduation set by the town of residence, who will enroll in a four-year accredited college or university in a teacher-training program that leads to a certification to teach.

Title: GFWC of Massachusetts International Study Abroad Scholarship
Description: Up to $500 for graduate or undergraduate study abroad. The award is to be used for a 12 Credit Summer Session, Semester, or Full Year Program beginning between June 1, 2017 and February 1, 2018.

Title: Julia Ward Howe Scholarship
Description: Up to $500 for graduate study in political science for a woman maintaining legal residence in Massachusetts for at least five years.

Title: Music Scholarship for Undergraduate in Voice
Description: Applicant must be a Massachusetts resident and an undergraduate currently enrolled in a four-year accredited college, university or school of music, majoring in voice.

Title: Nickels for Notes Music Scholarship
Description: 2017 Music Scholarship of up to $500 for high school seniors who will major in Piano, Instrument, Music Education, Music Therapy, or Voice.

Title: Pennies for Art Scholarship
Description: Up to $500 for Massachusetts high school senior. Portfolio to include three different examples of original 2D artwork in three different mediums (for example: Oils, Acrylic, Watercolor, Photography, etc...).

Title: Women's Italian Club of Boston Scholarship
Description: One $1000 scholarship for undergraduate study and two $1000 scholarships for undergraduate (college sophomore or junior) major in Music.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - Massachusetts
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: Massachusetts High Demand Scholarship Program
Description: The Massachusetts High Demand Scholarship Program was created by the Massachusetts Legislature to support economic growth and development. The purpose is to encourage degree completion in high demand disciplines that will help address the workforce needs of the Commonwealth by providing scholarship assistance to support the educational costs of students pursuing such programs of study. The application for the Massachusetts High Demand Scholarship is open to community college students who are pursuing a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Math) degree.

Title: Christian A. Herter Memorial Scholarship Program
Description: The Christian A. Herter Memorial Scholarship Program was established in 1972 by the Massachusetts State Legislature to recruit students in the 10th and 11th grades whose socio-economic backgrounds and environmental conditions may inhibit their ability to attain educational goals. The students that are selected for this program must have overcome major adversity in their lives (i.e. physical or mental abuse, catastrophic illness, etc.). Obstacles may be mental, physical, geographic, or societal.

Description: The American Legion Life Insurance Committee provides for a National Scholarship to be awarded to the Eagle Scout who is selected "The American Legion Eagle Scout of the Year." Title: Access College Early Scholarship Program
Description: The Access College Early (ACE) Scholarship Program pays tuition and mandatory fees for qualified, low-income high school students to enroll in college courses from Nebraska colleges or universities, either through dual-enrollment or early enrollment agreements with these institutions.

Title: Community College Gap Assistance Program
Description: The Community College Gap Assistance Program offers financial aid to community college students taking non-credit courses that could lead to jobs in high-need fields. These are low-income students who would not be eligible for federal financial aid because, although they're enrolled in college, they are not enrolled in courses for credit that lead directly to a degree.

Title: nebraska-opportunity-grant
Description: The State of Nebraska provides the Nebraska Opportunity Grant (NOG) - formerly the Nebraska State Grant - to students who meet certain qualifications. Qualifications include being a Nebraska resident, attending a Nebraska postsecondary institution, and having a minimum EFC as determined by completing the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - New Mexico
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: Bridge Scholarship
Description: The 3% (The Bridge) Scholarship is established by the board of regents of each institution to establish scholarships to students who are residents of New Mexico in an amount not to not to exceed tuition and fees. Eligible institutions shall ensure that all available 3% Scholarships are awarded before granting Lottery Scholarships.

Title: Legislative Lottery Scholarship
Description: The Legislative Lottery Scholarship will pay a portion of tuition (up to undergraduate degree) for students who have obtained New Mexico diploma of excellence or high school equivalency credential recipients who immediately attend a New Mexico public college or university.

Title: New Mexico Scholars Scholarship
Description: The New Mexico Scholars Scholarship encourages NM high school graduates to enroll in college full-time at a public or private non-profit postsecondary in NM before their 21st birthday in an undergraduate program.
