Title: $1,000 Easy Scholarship: Fill Out An Easy Pledge to Vote!
Description: You could win an easy $1,000 scholarship by filling out our easy pledge to vote this November. All you have to do is share why you plan on voting this fall. It takes less than 2 minutes! Fill out the online pledge form to automatically enter to win a $1,000 scholarship. Only applicable for 18 to 25 year olds. Let's Do This.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - New York
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: Acacio "Roger" Rodrigues Memorial Scholarship
Description: Established by the Rodrigues family, in memory of Acacio "Roger" Rodrigues, scholarships will be awarded to graduating high school seniors who reside in Dutchess, Putnam or Westchester County, New York or Fairfield County, Connecticut and who plan to study in a field which will lead to a career in the building/construction industry. These fields include but are not limited to architecture, engineering, construction management, electrical construction technology, plumbing and heating, welding and fabrication, etc. The scholarships will be awarded to individuals who are or will be full time students at any accredited vocational school, college or university in the United States.

Title: Alexander Cervone Scholarship
Description: Established in memory of gifted guitarist and musician Alexander Cervone, this scholarship is available to graduating high school seniors of Our Lady of Lourdes High School and Spackenkill High School who have demonstrated a passion or aptitude for music or history. The scholarship will be awarded to individuals who will be full time students at any accredited college or university in the United States. It may be used for tuition, books and fees.

Title: ATHENA Adult Scholarship
Description: Established by the Dutchess County Regional Chamber of Commerce to encourage increased leadership roles for women in our community this scholarship is available to any female who lives works or volunteers in Dutchess County and has been out of high school for at least 5 years and is pursuing education at an accredited New York State College, University or trade school or through an accredited online educational program while maintaining residency in Dutchess County. The scholarship award range is $1,000-$2,000.

Title: Bret Alan Frattellone Scholarship
Description: Established in memory of Bret Alan Frattellone. One scholarship will be awarded annually to a graduating senior from Lakeland High School who plans to major in communications, music education or music performance at any accredited college, or university in the United States.

Title: Charles S. North Scholarship for Music and Art
Description: Established by the Foundation and the Dutchess County Regional Chamber of Commerce to honor past Chamber President Charlie North and his love of music and to encourage the pursuit of music and arts in education; this scholarship is available to any graduating high school senior who is a resident of Dutchess County and is majoring in music performance, music/art education or visual arts (ceramics, drawing, painting, sculpture, printmaking, design, crafts, photography, video, filmmaking and architecture) at an accredited college or university in the United States.
Fields of study: Art, Fine Arts, Music, Visual Arts

Title: Christopher M. C. Ulanmo Memorial Scholarship
Description: The Christopher M. C. Ulanmo Memorial Scholarship honors Chris' life by making a scholarship available to high school seniors from John Jay High school who plan to enter college. Chris was a kind, happy, fun loving, giving and intelligent person who had a positive influence on everyone he knew. He was generous, loved family and community and had many friends. Chris was a teenager with a promising future and the ability to become anything. He aspired to become a doctor because he believed in service to others. The scholarship has been established to help others who exemplify generosity, intelligence, goodwill, and a love for life.

Title: David Jagaciewski Scholarship
Description: Established by family and friends in memory of David Jagaciewski who passed away on November 29, 2006. David was a teacher of technology education at Poughkeepsie High School for 33 years. This scholarship is established to assist students in receiving a post-secondary education. The scholarship shall be applied to tuition costs at an accredited college or university in the United States.

Title: Dennis J. Markle Memorial Scholarship
Description: Established by the family and friends of Dennis Markle the scholarship is available to a graduating student of Poughkeepsie High School or Millbrook High School planning to major in Education (students planning to major in History will be considered if there is not an appropriate candidate who intends to major in Education). The scholarship shall be applied to tuition costs at an accredited college or university in the United States.

Title: Flight 3047 Memorial Scholarship
Description: Flight 3407 Memorial Scholarship provides financial aid to children, spouses and financial dependents of individuals killed as a direct result of the crash of Continental Airlines Flight 3407 in Clarence, New York on February 12, 2009.

Title: Flight 587 Memorial Scholarship
Description: Flight 587 Memorial Scholarship provides financial aid to children, spouses and financial dependents of individuals killed as a direct result of American Airlines Flight 587's crash in the Belle Harbor neighborhood of Queens, New York on the morning of November 12, 2001.

Title: Meland Foundation Nursing Scholarship
Description: The Meland Foundation grants funding for scholarships to nurses in the NJ-NY-CT-PA area with BSN degrees wishing to pursue Nurse Practitioner degrees with a pediatric specialty and who share the vision of the Foundation. The Meland Foundation founded by a beloved pediatrician who built a successful family medical practice in Northern New Jersey provides and supports inspirational and informational programs to enhance the ability of families to care for loved ones and to provide hope to patients and their caregivers.

Title: NYS Achievement and Investment in Merit Scholarship (NY-AIMS)
Description: The NYS Achievement and Investment in Merit Scholarship (NY-AIMS) provides merit-based scholarships to NYS high school graduates who achieved academic excellence as a high school student, and enroll or plan to enroll in a public or private NYS college immediately after high school.

Title: NYS Memorial Scholarship
Description: The NYS Memorial Scholarship provides financial aid to children, spouses and financial dependents of deceased firefighters, volunteer firefighters, police officers, peace officers, and emergency medical service workers who have died as the result of injuries sustained in the line of duty in service to the State of New York.

Title: NYS STEM Incentive Program
Description: The NYS STEM Incentive Program provides a full SUNY tuition scholarship to the top 10 percent of students in each NYS high school if they pursue a STEM degree in an associate's or bachelor's degree program and agree to live in NYS and work in a STEM field in NYS for five years after graduation.

Title: NYS Tuition Assistance Program (TAP)
Description: The New York State Tuition Assistance Program (TAP) helps eligible New York residents pay tuition at approved schools in New York State. Depending on the academic year in which you begin study, an annual TAP award can be up to $5,165.

Title: Florence Kidder Memorial Scholarship
Description: The Florence Kidder Memorial Scholarship (FKMS) honors the memory of the first president of the National Society of the Colonial Dames of America in the State of North Carolina, Florence Hill Kidder.

Title: Golden LEAF Scholars Program
Description: The Golden LEAF Scholars Program is designed to assist current high school seniors and North Carolina community college transfer students. Recipients must be from certain rural counties, demonstrate both financial need and merit, and plan to attend participating North Carolina colleges and universities.

Title: Business and Professional Women of Raleigh Scholarship
Description: BPW/Raleigh scholarships are provided to outstanding area students seeking to further their education, advance their careers, or re-enter the workforce.

Title: Aubrey Lee Brooks Scholarships
Description: A scholarship program for graduating high school seniors from Alamance, Bertie, Caswell, Durham, Forsyth, Granville, Guilford, Orange, Person, Rockingham, Stokes, Surry, Swain and Warren Counties.

Title: North Carolina Hospitality Education Foundation Scholarship
Description: The scholarships offered by the N.C. Hospitality Education Foundation assist permanent North Carolina residents attending school in North Carolina for the entire academic year and pursuing culinary arts, hospitality management, or tourism.

Description: As Tallo continues to work with colleges and companies who are prioritizing diversity and inclusion, know that your voice is a key component. We encourage you to share your experiences in this scholarship application but know that your responses will be completely anonymous. Be sure to follow us on Instagram at @AppTallo where we will announce the winner!

Title: $1,000 Easy Scholarship: Fill Out An Easy Pledge to Vote!
Description: You could win an easy $1,000 scholarship by filling out our easy pledge to vote this November. All you have to do is share why you plan on voting this fall. It takes less than 2 minutes! Fill out the online pledge form to automatically enter to win a $1,000 scholarship. Only applicable for 18 to 25 year olds. Let's Do This.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - Ohio (Crown Scholars)
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: Charles D. Whitmer Fund Scholarship
Description: To help persons with an entrepreneurial spirit, at any age, attend (on a full-time basis) a college or university that is authorized to provide full credit toward a bachelor's or higher degree.

Title: Charlotte Alexander Scholarship
Description: This fund was established by a transfer of the Educational Trust of the Inner City Protestant Parish to the Cleveland Foundation to provide scholarship support to enable deserving individuals who are residents of Cleveland or its inner-ring suburbs to further and/or complete their formal education. Currently, the beneficiary pool is identified as high school seniors and adults to the age of 28, who are pursuing an undergraduate college degree, or vocational/technical training. Applicants with grade-point averages between 2.0 and 3.3 on a 4.0 grade scale are given preference.

Title: Cleveland Foundation Scholarship Selection and Advisory Committee Scholarship
Description: Providing scholarship support with a particular focus on enhancing access to higher education by those populations that are underserved or underrepresented in higher education programs. The program will provide scholarship grants to worthy students (including graduating high school seniors and academic achievers with financial need). Support will also be offered to those who are 21 years and older that are pursuing higher education, or a course of training that enhances their potential for gainful employment, and who demonstrate financial need. Examples of underserved are African-American or Hispanic males, Native Americans, adults returning to school, first-generation college attendees, and single heads of household.

Title: Cleveland's Future Engineers Scholarship
Description: The Cleveland's Future Engineers Scholarship Fund was created to advance education by providing scholarships to graduating high school seniors who are residents of Cuyahoga County, plan to attend a four-year college or university, have maintained a minimum 3.2 cumulative grade-point average (on a 4.0 scale), and have demonstrated both an interest and academic achievement in math, science, engineering, or computer technology (with a preference for applicants who plan to seek a career in civil engineering).

Title: Cydney Weingart Scholarship
Description: Providing support for public high school graduates enrolled in college as a freshman or sophomore, or enrolled in a vocational training program. The fund is specifically geared to select students who demonstrate a commitment to educational achievement and have a passion for an initial identified course of study or career path.

Title: Wilma A. Chapman Scholarship Fund
Description: To enhance scholarship opportunities for persons with mental challenges who aspire and have the potential to succeed in undertaking college/university course work at either the undergraduate or graduate level. The program is intended to offer scholarship grants annually to persons selected by a committee for awards.

Title: Alton LaMaur Character Memorial Scholarship
Description: Providing scholarship support for college-bound graduating seniors of Collinwood High School. Must have a 2.5 GPA. Selection decisions are based on academic merit, community involvement, leadership, and financial need. Preference given to African-Americans and individuals with a skill/interest in violence mediation/prevention.

Title: Arthur P. and Ruth H. Moebius Scholarship
Description: Helping students who are graduating seniors (or who have already graduated) from Aurora High School obtain an undergraduate college degree. Students must intend to enroll full-time at an accredited, Pell-eligible educational institution, or already be attending such an institution authorized to provide a program acceptable for full credit toward a bachelor's degree or a program of training designed to prepare students for gainful employment in a recognized occupation.

Title: Byrne-Rubin Family Trust Scholarship
Description: To provide scholarship support for a Glenville High School graduating senior who can demonstrate academic merit, financial need, leadership, and school or community involvement.

Title: Christina Sunga Ryook Scholarship
Description: Providing scholarship support as a memorial to honor the life of Christina Sunga Ryook, a graduate of the University of Michigan and Westlake High School, who died in New York City on Sept. 11, 2001. The Christina Sunga Ryook Memorial Scholarship is for Westlake High School graduates who will be attending the University of Michigan. Recipients are selected based on academic achievement, extracurricular activities, community involvement, leadership, personality, and financial need.

Title: Graham Family Scholarship
Description: Award of $7,500/year, renewable upon reapplication, for an incoming student who will graduate or has graduated from a Carroll County (Ohio) high school. Requires outstanding high school credentials and a portfolio of work.

Title: Ohio Safety Officers Memorial Fund
Description: This program provides tuition assistance to the children and spouses of peace officers, fire fighters and certain other safety officers who are killed in the line-of-duty, anywhere in the United States.

Title: Women's Civic Club of Cleveland Heights Scholarship
Description: The Women's Civic Club of Cleveland Heights has been providing scholarships to Cleveland Heights High School graduates for many years. In 2006, the group established an endowed scholarship fund at the Cleveland Foundation and asked that the foundation assume the responsibility for administering the scholarship program. Working in cooperation with the Cleveland Heights High School administration and guidance staff, the foundation will honor the intent of the fund and employ the same eligibility and selection criteria.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - Oklahoma
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: Academic Scholars Program
Description: The Academic Scholars Program, established by the state Legislature and governor in 1988 and operated by the Oklahoma State Regents for Higher Education, provides scholarships to academically outstanding students who attend an Oklahoma college or university.

Title: Chiropractic Education Scholarship Program
Description: The purpose of the Chiropractic Education Scholarship Program is to assist residents of the state of Oklahoma who are pursuing the study of chiropractic at accredited out-of-state schools.

Title: Future Teachers Scholarship Program
Description: The Future Teachers Scholarship Program was established by the Oklahoma State Regents for Higher Education as an incentive to encourage the preparation of teachers in critical shortage areas in the public schools of Oklahoma.

Title: Regional University Baccalaureate Scholarship
Description: This scholarship enables 11 participating public universities to provide up to four years of scholarship support to academically-promising Oklahoma students enrolled in a baccalaureate program.

Title: Teacher Shortage Employment Incentive Program (TSEIP)
Description: TSEIP was designed to recruit and retain mathematics and science teachers in Oklahoma. Successful candidates will be reimbursed eligible student loan expenses (a set amount, which may vary yearly) or an equivalent cash benefit.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - Oregon
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: Confederation of Oregon School Administrators Scholarships
Description: Each year COSA sponsors or assists in processing ten $1,000 college scholarships. These scholarships are given to Oregon seniors attending 2- or 4-year Oregon colleges. Due date for applications is March 1. Results are announced in April.

Title: James R. and Mary Jane Drury Scholarship
Description: For graduates of McKenzie River High School in Finn Rock, Oregon, to attend Oregon State University for the pursuit of a degree from the College of Forestry.

Title: OSAC Scholarship
Description: The Scholarship Team of OSAC combines access to hundreds of scholarships into one easy application for $16 million in scholarship awards. All types of scholarships are available. Many are based on criteria such as high school attended, school and community activities, academic interests, or career goals.

Title: St. Andrew's Society Scholarship
Description: For Oregon high school graduates who were born in Scotland or who have a parent or grandparent who was born in Scotland, or who have demonstrated a significant commitment to Highland dancing, piping, drumming, Celtic harp or Highland fiddle.

Title: Pacific Northwest Scholarship
Description: This scholarship is available to UNCF students who are permanent residents in the states of Oregon or Washington.

Fill out the online pledge form to automatically enter to win a $1,000 scholarship. Only applicable for 18 to 25 year olds. Let's Do This.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - Pennsylvania
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: Clarkston Scholars Program
Description: Each year, the Clarkston Scholars Program provides one sophomore attending a four-year college or university undergraduate program in Pennsylvania, majoring in a life sciences related field of study, a $10,000 scholarship award ($5,000 per year for junior and senior year). In addition, the Clarkston Scholar will receive exposure to the life sciences industry through mentoring with Clarkston Consulting and participation in Pennsylvania Bio events over the course of the two-year scholarship award period.

Title: Postsecondary Educational Gratuity Program
Description: This program honors individuals who lost their lives protecting the citizens of Pennsylvania by helping their children fund their education.
Link: This program honors individuals who lost their lives protecting the citizens of Pennsylvania by helping their children fund their education.

Title: Pennsylvania Targeted Industry Program (PA-TIP)
Description: The Pennsylvania General Assembly created PA-TIP in 2012 to prepare students with the skills in high demand by today's employers. Eligible areas of study include energy, advanced materials, diversified manufacturing, and agriculture and food production.

Title: Beulah Frey Environmental Scholarship
Description: ASWP awards $1,000 scholarships to graduating high school seniors from our service area of Allegheny, Armstrong, Butler, Beaver, Fayette, Washington, and Westmoreland counties. Students who are applying to two or four-year colleges to further their studies in an environmentally-related field are eligible to apply.

Title: Hope Through Learning Award
Description: The Hope Through Learning Award is a $2,500 award available to youth age 24 and under residing in Allegheny County who are experiencing or have experienced homelessness during their school attendance years, and who are going on to a higher education or career training program for the first time. Homelessness is defined as lacking a fixed, regular, and adequate night-time residence, and includes students living in a shelter, car, motel, doubled-up situation, or places not meant for human habitation.

Title: AT&T Communications Scholarship
Description: AT&T is providing scholarships to students at Pennsylvania State System of Higher Education (State System) universities who are pursuing a degree in Communications, Retail Sales Management or Hotel and Restaurant Management. This is a one-time scholarship available to juniors and seniors who meet the eligibility requirements and the student requirements.

Title: AT&T STEM Award: Improving PA's Future Workforce for the Computer Technology, Advanced Manufacturing and Energy Industries
Description: Funded by AT&T, the purpose of this award is to improve retention and completion rates of students majoring in a STEM related program which will impact the computer technology, advanced manufacturing and energy industries.

Title: Blind or Deaf Beneficiary Grant Program Update
Description: This state-funded program provides financial aid to blind or deaf students attending a postsecondary institution.

Title: Hershey Entertainment & Resorts (HE&R) Hospitality Scholarship
Description: HE&R is providing five (5) state system students, who are pursuing a degree that benefits the hospitality industry, such as: hospitality, marketing, human resources, information technology or criminal justice, with a $1,000 scholarship. This one-time scholarship award is available to juniors and seniors who meet the eligibility requirements as well as the student requirements

Title: Highmark Healthcare Scholarship for Rising Juniors
Description: This scholarship is generously funded by Highmark to help address the ever-growing need for trained healthcare professionals to meet the demands of the Commonwealth and beyond.

Title: M&T BANK SCHOLARSHIP
Description: M&T Bank is generously funding fifteen (15) $1,000 scholarships that will be awarded to incoming freshmen at the 14 Pennsylvania's State System of Higher Education universities who demonstrate financial need based on standard need analysis from the FAFSA application and who reside in the specified central PA counties.

Title: The Meland Foundation grants funding for scholarships to nurses in the NJ-NY-CT-PA area with BSN degrees wishing to pursue Nurse Practitioner degrees with a pediatric specialty and who share the vision of the Foundation. The Meland Foundation founded by a beloved pediatrician who built a successful family medical practice in Northern New Jersey provides and supports inspirational and informational programs to enhance the ability of families to care for loved ones and to provide hope to patients and their caregivers.
Description: The Meland Foundation grants funding for scholarships to nurses in the NJ-NY-CT-PA area with BSN degrees wishing to pursue Nurse Practitioner degrees with a pediatric specialty and who share the vision of the Foundation. The Meland Foundation founded by a beloved pediatrician who built a successful family medical practice in Northern New Jersey provides and supports inspirational and informational programs to enhance the ability of families to care for loved ones and to provide hope to patients and their caregivers.

Title: Momentum, Inc. Healthcare Scholarship
Description: Funded by Momentum, Inc., management consultants in Camp Hill, PA, this scholarship is limited to full-time juniors and seniors at State System universities who are majoring in a health-care related field and meet the eligibility requirements.

Title: Pennsylvania State Grant Program
Description: The Pennsylvania State Grant Program provides college tuition assistance to students who meet eligibility requirements as determined by the FAFSA and the program application.

Title: Scholarship Incentive Program
Description: For legal residents of Delaware enrolling full-time in an undergraduate or graduate degree program at a nonprofit, regionally accredited institution in Delaware or Pennsylvania.

Title: William D. Greenlee Scholarship
Description: Among his numerous accomplishments throughout his vast and elaborate career, Mr. Greenlee's was most proud of his service to the community through a number of local charities including serving as the Chair of the Board of the Pennsylvania State System of Higher Education Foundation. The William D. Greenlee Scholarship is a fitting tribute to a gentleman who gave generously of himself to help others.

Title: Beverly J. Smith Memorial Scholarship
Description: The Beverly J. Smith Memorial Scholarship was established by the Harrisburg Branch of the AAUW to honor our past president. Ms. Smith was a nationally known and respected expert on refugee resettlement and immigration. She devoted her life to helping people of diverse nationalities begin new lives and obtain education, homes, health care, and legal advice. We want to honor her memory by assisting the education of a woman working towards a Bachelor's degree. We would especially like to assist someone who embodies Ms. Smith's vision.

Title: Sue C. Peck Scholarship
Description: The Sue C. Peck Scholarship was established by the Harrisburg Branch of the AAUW as part of our continued commitment to the community and the education of women. Mrs. Peck is an active member of her community and is especially interested in assisting women engaged in pursuing additional education. Thus, she is sponsoring this scholarship for the education of a woman enrolled as a student at a Pennsylvania college or university

Title: Dakota Corps Scholarship
Description: The Dakota Corps Scholarship was designed for high school students in South Dakota to provide full tuition and generally-applicable fees to selected qualified applicants.
Fields of study: Education, Engineering, Finance/Accounting, Information Technology, Nursing

Title: Jump Start Scholarship
Description: The Jump Start Scholarship provides tuition aid to students who graduate high school in three years or less and attend a South Dakota institution.

Title: Critical Teaching Needs Scholarship
Description: The purpose of this scholarship is to encourage South Dakota's high school graduates to obtain their postsecondary education in South Dakota for teaching, to remain in the state upon completion of their education, and to contribute to the state and its citizens by working in a critical need teaching area.

Title: South Dakota Opportunity Scholarship
Description: The South Dakota Opportunity Scholarship provides merit-based aid for highly accomplished high school students attending college in South Dakota.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - Tennessee
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: Tennessee Promise Scholarship
Description: Tennessee Promise is both a scholarship and mentoring program focused on increasing the number of students that attend college in our state. It provides students a last-dollar scholarship, meaning the scholarship will cover tuition and fees not covered by the Pell grant, the HOPE scholarship, or state student assistance funds. Students may use the scholarship at any of the state's 13 community colleges, 27 colleges of applied technology, or other eligible institution offering an associate's degree program.
Fields of study: Education, Engineering, Finance/Accounting, Information Technology, Nursing

Title: Aspire Award
Description: The Aspire Award is a need-based supplement to the Tennessee HOPE Scholarship.

Title: Christa McAuliffe Scholarship Program
Description: The scholarship is intended to assist and support a Tennessee resident who has demonstrated a commitment to a career in educating the youth of Tennessee. This is a one time $500 scholarship.

Title: Dependent Children Scholarship Program
Description: The Dependent Children Scholarship Program provides aid for Tennessee residents who are dependent children of a Tennessee law enforcement officer, fireman, or an emergency medical service technician who has been killed or totally and permanently disabled while performing duties within the scope of such employment. The parent must be a Tennessee resident and have been on duty when the incident occurred. The scholarship is awarded to full-time undergraduate students attending eligible Tennessee institutions.

Title: Dual Enrollment Grant
Description: The Dual Enrollment Grant program provides a grant for study at an eligible postsecondary institution that is awarded to students who are attending an eligible high school and who are also enrolled in college courses at eligible postsecondary institutions for which they will receive college credit.

Title: General Assembly Merit Scholarship
Description: The General Assembly Merit Scholarship acts as a supplement to the Tennessee Hope Scholarship for highly competitive students.

Title: Tennessee HOPE Access Grant
Description: The Tennessee HOPE Access Grant is a need-based supplement to the Tennessee HOPE Scholarship.

Title: Tennessee HOPE Foster Child Tuition Grant
Description: This scholarship serves as a supplement to the Tennessee HOPE Scholarship for foster children (defined as students who have been in the custody of the Tennessee Department of Children's Services for at least one year after reaching age fourteen).
Fields of study: Education, Engineering, Finance/Accounting, Information Technology, Nursing

Title: Tennessee HOPE Scholarship
Description: The HOPE Scholarship provides scholarship aid to Tennessee residents attending an eligible Tennessee college or university who maintain at least a 3.0 GPA. Most Tennessee Colleges are eligible and award amounts vary by school and are typically between $1,000 and $2,250 per semester for full-time students.

Title: Tennessee Reconnect TCAT Grant
Description: The Reconnect Grant helps student with a FAFSA dependency status of "Independent" pay toward a certificate or degree at one of Tennessee Centers for Applied Technology (TCATs). TCATs are located throughout the state of Tennessee, and provide a wide range of technical and occupational training programs, providing quality technical education to connect students with high quality careers.

Title: Tennessee STEP UP Scholarship
Description: The Tennessee STEP UP Scholarship is a program designed to assist students with intellectual disabilities who have completed high school and enroll in a two-year individualized program at an eligible postsecondary institution.

Title: Tennessee Student Assistance Award
Description: The Tennessee Student Assistance Award Program (TSAA) was established to provide non-repayable financial assistance to financially-needy undergraduate students who are residents of Tennessee. Applicants must be enrolled or accepted for enrollment, at least half time, at a public or an eligible non-public postsecondary institution in Tennessee.

Title: Tennessee Teaching Scholars Program
Description: The Tennessee Teaching Scholars Program is intended to encourage exemplary students to enter the teaching field in Tennessee. Participation is limited to college juniors, seniors, and post baccalaureate candidates admitted to a teacher education program in a Tennessee college or university.

Title: Regents' Scholarship
Description: The Regents' Scholarship is designed to assist first-generation college students in achieving their educational goals at Texas A&M University.

Title: Unrestricted Endowed Presidential Scholarships
Description: The Unrestricted Endowed Presidential Scholarships are for students enrolled for 15 hours per semester and are open to students of any major at the University of Texas at Austin.

Title: "Every Drop Counts" Earth Science Scholarship
Description: Applicant must currently be a US citizen, Texas resident, and accepted to or enrolled in a four year, accredited college or university or earth/environmental science graduate study program with the intention of studying earth/environmental sciences.

Title: Fifth Year Accounting Student Scholarship Program
Description: This program seeks to promote the professional and educational needs of Texas; increase the number of highly trained and educated professional accountants available to serve the residents of this state; improve the state's business environment and encourage economic development and financial stability; and identify, recognize and support outstanding scholars who plan to pursue careers in accounting.

Title: Texas Educational Opportunity Grant Program (TEOG)
Description: The TEOG provides grant aid to financially needy students enrolled in Texas public two-year colleges.

Title: TEXAS Grant
Description: The Texas Legislature established the TEXAS (Towards EXcellence, Access and Success) Grant to make sure that well-prepared high school graduates with financial need could go to college.

Title: Texas Public Educational Grant
Description: This program provides grant assistance to students with financial need.

Title: Top 10 Percent Scholarship
Description: The Top 10 Percent Scholarship encourages and assists students who graduate in the top 10 percent of their high school class to attend a Texas public institution of higher education.

Title: Tuition Equalization Grant Program
Description: To provide grant aid to financially needy students to enable them to attend private, non-profit colleges or universities in Texas.

Title: New Century Scholarship
Description: The New Century Scholarship encourages Utah high school students to accelerate their education by earning an associate degree in high school from an institution within the Utah System of Higher Education or completing a specific math and science curriculum. The scholarship may be used at any four-year public college or university in the Utah System of Higher Education, as well as at Brigham Young University - Provo, and Westminster College.

Title: Regents' Scholarship
Description: The Regents' Scholarship encourages Utah high school students to prepare for college academically and financially by taking a core course of study and saving for college. The scholarship may be used at any public college or university in the Utah System of Higher Education, as well as at Brigham Young University - Provo, LDS Business College, and Westminster College.

Title: Vermont Incentive Grant
Description: This grant assists Vermont residents taking 12 or more credits per term in a degree or certificate program.

Title: Vermont Non-Degree Grant
Description: This grant assists Vermont residents enrolled in a non-degree course or program.

Title: Vermont Part-Time Grant
Description: This grant assists Vermont residents taking fewer than 12 credits per term in a degree or certificate program.

Title: TALLO'S $1,000 "DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION" SCHOLARSHIP
Description: As Tallo continues to work with colleges and companies who are prioritizing diversity and inclusion, know that your voice is a key component. We encourage you to share your experiences in this scholarship application but know that your responses will be completely anonymous. Be sure to follow us on Instagram at @AppTallo where we will announce the winner!

Title: $1,000 Easy Scholarship: Fill Out An Easy Pledge to Vote!
Description: You could win an easy $1,000 scholarship by filling out our easy pledge to vote this November. All you have to do is share why you plan on voting this fall. It takes less than 2 minutes! Fill out the online pledge form to automatically enter to win a $1,000 scholarship. Only applicable for 18 to 25 year olds. Let's Do This.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - DC, Maryland, Virginia
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: Civil Engineering Scholarship Program
Description: The Civil Engineering Scholarship Program (CESP) provides civil engineering students the opportunity to gain valuable, real-world work experience, earn money over the summer and receive stipends to assist with educational expenses.

Title: Undergraduate STEM Research Scholarship Program
Description: The VSGC Undergraduate STEM Research Scholarship Program provides awards of up to $8,500 to rising juniors and seniors who are enrolled full-time in a program of study in science, technology, engineering, or math (STEM) and have a specific faculty-mentored research project that has NASA or aerospace relevance.

Title: Brown v. Board of Education Scholarship
Description: The Brown v. Board of Education Scholarship Program was established in accordance with 30-231.8 of the Code of Virginia for the purpose of providing a public education to persons who were denied an education in the public schools of Virginia between 1954 and 1964, in jurisdictions in which the public schools were closed to avoid desegregation.

Title: Underwood-Smith Teacher Scholarship Program
Description: The Underwood-Smith Teacher Scholarship Program is a student financial aid program designed to enable and encourage students to pursue teaching careers at the pre-school, elementary, middle or secondary school level.

Title: West Virginia Engineering, Science and Technology Scholarship Program
Description: West Virginia Engineering, Science and Technology Scholarship Program is a student financial aid program designed to enable and encourage academically talented individuals to pursue careers in the fields of engineering, science and technology. Scholarships, not to exceed $3,000 per academic year, are awarded on the basis of academic qualifications and interest in the fields of engineering, science and technology.

Title: West Virginia PROMISE Scholarship
Description: The PROMISE Scholarship is a merit-based financial aid program for West Virginia residents. Students who achieve certain academic goals are eligible to receive funds to help pay for college.

Title: Granville P. Meade Scholarship
Description: The Granville P. Meade Scholarship provides financial assistance to students who have achieved academically, but who are financially unable to attend college. The Granville P. Meade fund provides scholarship awards to worthy and financially disadvantaged Virginia high school seniors to attend one of Virginia's public or private colleges or universities.

Title: Virginia Tuition Assistance Grant
Description: Established in 1972, the Tuition Assistance Grant Program (VTAG) is designed to assist Virginia residents who attend accredited private, nonprofit colleges and universities in Virginia for other than religious training or theological education.

Title: Foster Children Tuition Grant
Description: Tuition grants are available for students who were in foster care, custody of social services and special needs adoptees at time of graduation or GED, and attend a Virginia Community College.

Title: Senior Citizens Tuition Waver
Description: A senior citizen may take courses without paying tuition or required fees, except for course materials, under certain conditions. If the senior citizen has taxable income of not more than $23,850 in the preceding year, the individual may take a course for academic credit free of tuition and fees, except for fees established for the purpose of paying for course materials, such as laboratory fees. A senior citizen, regardless of income level, may audit a course that is given for academic credit or take a noncredit course free of tuition and fees, except for fees established for the purpose of paying for course materials, such as laboratory fees.

Title: The Virginia Museum of Fine Arts Fellowship Program
Description: The Virginia Museum of Fine Arts Fellowship Program is a vital source of funding for the visual arts and art history in Virginia. VMFA is committed to supporting professional artists as well as art and art history students who demonstrate exceptional creative ability in their chosen discipline and, as such, has awarded nearly $5.5 million in Fellowships to Virginians.

Title: theWashBoard.org Combined Scholarship Application
Description: TheWashBoard.org is a free, student-centered, online clearinghouse for Washington students seeking college scholarships. This user-friendly site allows students to search and apply for scholarship opportunities that are specific to their academic interests, college, university, or other criteria.

Title: Tobacco Region Scholarship Program
Description: The Virginia Tobacco Indemnification and Community Revitalization Commission (Tobacco Commission) established a Bachelor's Degree scholarship program in 2002 to strengthen the economies of Southwest (SW) and Southside (SS) Virginia through education and training of its citizens. The Tobacco Region Scholarship Program provides assistance with tuition for eligible students who live in one of the SW localities or SS localities and who are enrolled in a Bachelor's Degree program at an accredited 4-year college or university, whether public or private, in-state or out-of-state.

Title: Two-Year College Transfer Grant
Description: The Two-Year College Transfer Grant Program (CTG) provides an incentive for students to first complete an associate degree at a Virginia public two-year college before transferring to a participating Virginia four-year college or university as a means to reduce the overall cost towards completing a bachelor's degree.

Title: Virginia Child Care Provider Scholarship
Description: The purpose of this tuition assistance program is to offer child care providers foundational knowledge and skills in the care and development of children. Funded by the federal Child Care and Development Fund, the program allows early educators to attend undergraduate courses at Virginia's accredited colleges.

Title: Virginia Commonwealth Award
Description: The purpose of the Virginia Commonwealth Award is to assist undergraduate students with financial need and graduate students to pay part of their college costs. Funds may be used for need-based grants to Virginia resident undergraduates or for grants or assistantships to graduate students (both in-state and out-of-state)

Title: Virginia Guaranteed Assistance Program
Description: The purpose of the Virginia Guaranteed Assistance Program (VGAP) is to provide an incentive to financially needy students now attending elementary and secondary school in Virginia to raise their expectations and their academic performance and to consider higher education an achievable objective in their future.

Title: Virginia Military Survivors and Dependents Education Program
Description: The Virginia Military Survivors and Dependents Education Program (VMSDEP) is a Commonwealth of Virginia program which provides education benefits to spouses and children of military service members killed, missing in action, taken prisoner, or who became at least 90 percent disabled as a result of military service in an armed conflict.

Title: Virginia Nursing Scholarships
Description: The State of Virginia provides several scholarships to encourage the education of nurses to serve in underserved regions across the state.

Title: Virginia Part-Time Assistance Program
Description: The purpose of the Virginia Part-Time Assistance Program is to assist undergraduate, part-time students with financial need to pay part of their college costs. The funds are appropriated directly to each of Virginia's community colleges. Funds may be used for need-based grants to Virginia resident undergraduates enrolled part-time.

Title: Washington State Financial Aid
Description: Washington state provides a combined application for various state-funded aid programs.

Title: Horatio Alger State Scholarship - Wisconsin
Description: The Horatio Alger Association, through the generosity of its members, provides aid to students in all states who have displayed integrity and perseverance in overcoming adversity.

Title: Hearing & Visually Handicapped Student Grant
Description: The Handicapped Student Grant Program was established to provide funding for undergraduate Wisconsin residents, enrolled at in-state or eligible out-of-state public or independent institutions who show financial need and have a severe or profound hearing or visual impairment.

Title: Minority Undergraduate Retention Grant
Description: Awards under this program are made to Wisconsin resident minority undergraduates, excluding first year students, enrolled at least half-time in independent, tribal, or Wisconsin Technical College institutions. According to the statutes, a minority student is defined as a student who is either an African American; American Indian; Hispanic; or Southeast Asian from Laos, Cambodia, or Vietnam admitted to the U. S. after December 31, 1975.

Title: Talent Incentive Program Grant
Description: The Talent Incentive Program (TIP) Grant provides grant assistance to the most financially needy and educationally disadvantaged Wisconsin resident students attending colleges and universities in the State of Wisconsin. First-time freshmen students are nominated for the TIP Grant by the school financial aid offices or by counselors of the Wisconsin Educational Opportunity Programs (WEOP).

Title: Tools of the Trade $1,000 Apprentice Scholarship
Description: This scholarship aims to help hard-working apprentices at Wisconsin technical colleges meet their costs, so they complete their programs and build rewarding careers in the in-demand trades that will help move Wisconsin forward.
Link: Tools of the Trade $1,000 Apprentice Scholarship

Title: Wisconsin Grant
Description: The Wisconsin Grant Program provides grant assistance to undergraduate, Wisconsin residents enrolled at least half-time in degree or certificate programs at University of Wisconsin, Wisconsin Technical College, and Tribal institutions.

Title: Wisconsin Grant - Private Non-Profit
Description: The Wisconsin Grant (WG-PNP) Program provides grant assistance to undergraduate, Wisconsin residents enrolled at least half-time in degree or certificate programs at non-profit, independent colleges or universities based in Wisconsin.

Title: Massachusetts High Demand Scholarship Program
Description: The Massachusetts High Demand Scholarship Program was created by the Massachusetts Legislature to support economic growth and development. The purpose is to encourage degree completion in high demand disciplines that will help address the workforce needs of the Commonwealth by providing scholarship assistance to support the educational costs of students pursuing such programs of study. The application for the Massachusetts High Demand Scholarship is open to community college students who are pursuing a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Math) degree.
Fields of study: Agriculture, Astronomy/Astrophysics, Biology, Chemistry, Computer Science, Earth Science/Geology, Engineering, Information Technology, Physics, Pre-Medicine, Psychology

Title: Honeywell Scholarship
Description: This scholarship provides aid for current freshmen who are pursuing a STEM degree at a Honeywell Partner School or Horatio Alger Collegiate Partner institution.
Fields of study: Agriculture, Astronomy/Astrophysics, Biology, Chemistry, Computer Science, Earth Science/Geology, Engineering, Information Technology, Physics, Pre-Medicine, Psychology

Title: AFA Leader and Academic Scholarships
Description: AFA provides 30-35 AFA Leader and Academic Scholarships annually to graduating high school seniors or current college students, enrolling/enrolled in a agriculture-related, four-year degree program in the United States. These scholarships are supported by AFA Organizational Partners.

Title: John E. Lobdell Undergraduate Scholarship
Description: The scholarship is designed to assist eligible students in their pursuit of an academic degree in anthropology, or a clearly related degree program/curriculum, or interdisciplinary degree that includes anthropology as a significant component. Students should have an interest in the anthropology of the north.

Title: Structural Engineering/Architecture Student Scholarship Program
Description: Simpson Strong-Tie Company, Inc. has established a scholarship program to assist architecture, structural engineering and construction management students at participating colleges and universities in various communities in the United States. The Structural Engineering/Architecture Student Scholarship Program offers scholarships to support education and encourage the design and building of safer structures in our communities.

Title: International Aluminum Extrusion Design Competition
Description: Students studying design, engineering, architecture or related fields are invited to enter the International Aluminum Extrusion Design Competition. Show off your talent, ingenuity and creativity by designing products and systems that feature extruded aluminum.

Title: The Diversity Advancement Scholarship
Description: We aim to provide assistance to individuals from a minority race or ethnicity who intend to become an architect through the pursuit of a NAAB-accredited professional degree in architecture.

Title: $500 Art Scholarship
Description: Open to all high school and college students interested in studying an art-related major. Simply log in or create a free account below to apply.

Title: Visual Arts Scholarship
Description: The visual arts scholarships are four-year awards to incoming first-year students, with a total value from $8,000 to $32,000 per award. Transfer students may also compete for the award and recipients will receive from $2,000 to $8,000/year until completion of their Concordia degree and fulfillment of additional renewal criteria.
Fields of study: Visual Arts, Art, Fine Arts, Design

Title: The John F. and Anna Lee Stacey Scholarship Fund
Description: In accordance with the will of the late Anna Lee Stacey, a trust fund has been created for the education of young men and women who aim to make art their profession.

Title: Edna Ione Hall Scholarship
Description: The scholarship recipient must be a full time student majoring, minoring, or taking classes within the college (during the year of the award). Preference will be given to international, out-of-state or minority students, and/or students with financial need (FAFSA recommended). The recipient may be an incoming or continuing student.

Title: Wisconsin Lutheran College Art Scholarship
Description: The art scholarship consists of $1,000 given each year for an equivalent value of $4,000 over four years. Four art scholarships will be awarded each year. These scholarships may be given in addition to other academic scholarships that the college offers.

Title: Future Business Leaders of America National Scholarship Program
Description: High school seniors graduating in 2017 who are members of FBLA may apply for The Art Institutes Future Business Leaders of America Scholarship.

Title: SUNY Plattsburgh Winkel Scholarships
Description: For continuing SUNY Plattsburgh Art Majors who have at least a 3.0 GPA in art courses and incoming freshmen who have declared art as their major. Graduating art majors are not eligible for Winkel Scholarships, but they may be eligible for a Winkel Post-Graduate Internship.

Title: CBC Spouses Visual Arts Scholarship
Description: This award is for students with majors in the visual arts including, but not limited to, architecture, ceramics, drawing, fashion, graphic design, illustration, interior design, painting, photography, sketching, video production and other decorative arts.

Title: Worldstudio AIGA Scholarship
Description: Worldstudio AIGA Scholarships allow U.S. college students from minority and economically disadvantaged backgrounds not only to realize their artistic dreams, but also to give back to their communities.

Title: SkillsUSA Championship
Description: Secondary and postsecondary students who are members of SkillsUSA may compete in national championships.

Title: Archibald Motley Student Fund
Description: The Archibald Motley Student Fund was established in 2003 to provide financial assistance to currently enrolled undergraduate and graduate SAIC students whose work explores the African diaspora.

Title: Auburn University Department of Art Annual Scholarships
Description: Two $500 scholarships are awarded each year to an Auburn University student or incoming student who is seeking an undergraduate degree in Studio Art (BA in Art or BFA in Studio Art), or Art History (BA in Art [formal option in Art History]) and has a minimum overall 3.0 GPA. Studio Art majors should demonstrate quality in their artwork and overall accomplishments in the degree program and Art History majors should demonstrate writing ability and noteworthy scholarship. Preference will be given to students with demonstrated financial need.

Title: C-CAP Careers Through Culinary Arts Program
Description: High school seniors graduating who are enrolled in a C-CAP program may compete for one nationwide, full-tuition scholarship to be used for either a two- or four-year degree program at any one of over 40 U.S. schools comprising The International Culinary Schools at The Art Institutes. Scholarship value is approximately $38,000 - $95,000; current tuition rates at chosen school will apply. Tuition scholarships are not redeemable for cash. The tuition scholarship covers academic tuition and may not be applied against fees, housing, living expenses, or program supplies and may not be transferred between affiliate schools.

Title: Central Michigan University Art Scholarships
Description: Central Michigan University provides a variety of scholarships for entering and continuing students who major (or intend to major) in Art.
Fields of study: Art, Fine Arts, Visual Arts, Biology

Title: Competitive Excellence Award
Description: This $2,000 renewable scholarship is awarded to incoming first-year students for their participation in one of the following art exhibitions or competitions: Chicago Public Schools All-City Senior Portfolio Exhibition, Art Institute Re:Imagine24 Youth Competition, Illinois High Schools Regional Arts Exhibition, Ohio Governor's Youth Arts Exhibition, National Scholastic Art and Writing Awards, and National YoungArts Foundation.

Title: DECA Scholarship
Description: DECA high school senior students graduating are eligible to receive up to a $1,000 scholarship for participation in the organization. DECA high school senior students graduating who are members of DECA can compete in DECA State and/or DECA International competitions. DECA students who are first place winners at the State Level competitions can receive up to $1,500 in addition to the member amount. DECA students who are first-place winners at the DECA International Career Development Conference (ICDC) competitions can receive $5,000 in addition to the DECA State Scholarship and the member amount.

Title: Department of Art & Art History Incoming Freshman Scholarship
Description: The Department of Art and Art History awards two Incoming Freshman Scholarships each year. Awards are granted based on academic and artistic and art historical scholarly promise evident in the application submitted.

Title: Dexter Jones Award
Description: The Dexter Jones Award, an unrestricted prize of $5,000, is presented annually to a sculptor for an outstanding work of sculpture in bas-relief.

Title: Dr. Emily Farnham Graduate Scholarship in Art History
Description: Award of $500-$1,700 per semester, renewable for a second semester upon reapplication, for an incoming grad student in art history. Requires strong credentials in art history, a sample of research writing and a statement of intent for M.A. study.

Title: Elmer, Virginia, & Karen Novotny Scholarship
Description: The Alex J. Ettl and Marilyn Newmark Memorial Grants are unrestricted prizes of $5,000 each. They are awarded annually to a sculptor (the Newmark is for a sculptor specializing in animal sculpture) who has demonstrated a commitment to sculpting and an outstanding ability in his or her body of work.

Title: James Madison Incoming Students Art Scholarships
Description: Awarded with monies from the annual art auction and contributions from alumni, faculty, students, and patrons of the arts. Recipients shall be incoming freshmen or undergraduate art majors who show artistic accomplishments in art history or art education.

Title: Lacy Ann Livingston Endowed Scholarship in the Visual Arts
Description: The University Scholarship Committee will select a recipient who is of good moral character and a full-time Art major with an overall GPA of 3.0 or higher, or an incoming freshman planning to major in art with a high school GPA of 3.25 or higher.

Title: Linda & Vincent Buonanno Contemporary Practices Scholarship
Description: Art Institute Trustee and SAIC Board of Governor Linda Buonanno and her husband Vincent created this scholarship to support mid-career students. It is awarded through a competitive merit-based selection process to undergraduate students who have completed their first year at SAIC. Selected students each receive $5,000 annually during their sophomore, junior, and senior years, for a total award of $15,000.

Title: Montana State University Art Scholarships
Description: The School of Art awards a minimum of 2 $3,000 scholarships every year to high school seniors based upon portfolio requirements. The scholarship is based primarily on a portfolio review of a CD of work, grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 or higher, and a short essay. Portfolios should consist of 10 works and all work must be represented on a CD, no photographs or original work will be accepted.

Title: National ProStart Invitational Culinary Competition Scholarship
Description: The National ProStart Invitational is a national secondary school competition focused on restaurant management and culinary arts. Annually, 350 student competitors put their skills to the test in front of industry leaders, NRAEF Trustees, state restaurant associations, and family and friends - all with hopes of earning a coveted scholarship from one of the nation's largest culinary and restaurant management programs. The culinary competition highlights each team's creative abilities through the preparation of a three-course meal in 60 minutes, using only two butane burners, and without access to running water or electricity. Students are evaluated on taste, skill, teamwork, safety and sanitation.

Title: National ProStart Invitational Management Competition Scholarship
Description: The National ProStart Invitational is a national secondary school competition focused on restaurant management and culinary arts. Annually, 350 student competitors put their skills to the test in front of industry leaders, NRAEF Trustees, state restaurant associations, and family and friends - all with hopes of earning a coveted scholarship from one of the nation's largest culinary and restaurant management programs. Management teams develop a proposal for the next promising restaurant concept and present it to a panel of industry judges. Next, their problem solving skills are tested as they quickly solve challenges faced by managers daily.

Title: Phi Theta Kappa National Honor Society Scholarship
Description: The Art Institutes system is proud to offer a $1,000 Tuition Scholarship to all eligible Phi Theta Kappa members. Phi Theta Kappa members who graduate with an associate's degree from a community college and have been accepted into a bachelor's degree program at any Art Institutes school are eligible to receive the scholarship. The $1000 Tuition scholarship will be awarded upon acceptance and enrollment into a bachelor's degree program and applied to the first quarter.

Title: ProStart State Scholarships
Description: Admitted Phi Theta Kappa applicants will qualify to receive a $2,000 PTK Scholarship, per academic year, through the admission process once PTK status is verified.

Title: The Scholastic Art & Writing Awards
Description: Four nationwide $10,000 scholarships will be awarded by The Art Institutes to the Scholastic National Award Recipients on a first-come, first-served basis.

Title: The Virginia Museum of Fine Arts Fellowship Program
Description: The Virginia Museum of Fine Arts Fellowship Program is a vital source of funding for the visual arts and art history in Virginia. VMFA is committed to supporting professional artists as well as art and art history students who demonstrate exceptional creative ability in their chosen discipline and, as such, has awarded nearly $5.5 million in Fellowships to Virginians.

Title: University of Utah Art Scholarships
Description: The Department of Art and Art History offers multiple one-year residential tuition Departmental Scholarships in the amount of $5,000. Those eligible for the art history scholarship include Utah resident declared art history majors. Those eligible for studio art scholarships are Utah resident high school students who plan to become art majors, Utah resident art majors currently enrolled at the University and Utah resident transfer students who have declared art as their major.

Title: Freshman Undergraduate Research Program (FURP)
Description: This is your chance to do research for pay while investigating various fields of study. If you are a freshman, FURP can offer you a low-risk chance to do research before making any life changing decisions about your major. FURP offers you a way to enhance your research skills as well as provide an avenue where you can learn more about your major. FURP provides students with a learning experience that closely resembles how science and engineering are done in the real world.
Fields of study: Veterinary Studies, Psychology, Pre-Medicine, Physics, Nutritional Science, Nursing, Mathematics/Statistics, Kinesiology/Exercise Science, Information Technology, Health Professions, Engineering, Earth Science/Geology, Dental Studies, Computer Science, Chemistry, Biology, Astronomy/Astrophysics

Title: Minority Undergraduate Laboratory Research Experience (MURE)
Description: This is your chance to do research for pay while investigating various fields of study. If you are a minority student, MURE can offer you a low-risk chance to do research before making any life changing decisions about your major. If you are an undergraduate Penn State student planning on being here for at least one more year, MURE offers you a way to enhance your research skills as well as provide an avenue where you can learn more about your major. MURE provides students with a learning experience that closely resembles how science and engineering are done in the real world.
Fields of study: Veterinary Studies, Psychology, Pre-Medicine, Physics, Nutritional Science, Nursing, Mathematics/Statistics, Kinesiology/Exercise Science, Information Technology, Health Professions, Engineering, Earth Science/Geology, Dental Studies, Computer Science, Chemistry, Biology, Astronomy/Astrophysics

Title: Massachusetts High Demand Scholarship Program
Description: The Massachusetts High Demand Scholarship Program was created by the Massachusetts Legislature to support economic growth and development. The purpose is to encourage degree completion in high demand disciplines that will help address the workforce needs of the Commonwealth by providing scholarship assistance to support the educational costs of students pursuing such programs of study. The application for the Massachusetts High Demand Scholarship is open to community college students who are pursuing a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Math) degree.
Fields of study: Agriculture, Astronomy/Astrophysics, Biology, Chemistry, Computer Science, Earth Science/Geology, Engineering, Information Technology, Physics, Pre-Medicine, Psychology

Title: Science, Mathematics And Research for Transformation (SMART) Scholarship for Service Program
Description: The Science, Mathematics And Research for Transformation (SMART) Scholarship for Service Program is an opportunity for students pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) disciplines to receive a full scholarship and be gainfully employed upon degree completion.
Fields of study: Veterinary Studies, Psychology, Pre-Medicine, Physics, Nutritional Science, Nursing, Mathematics/Statistics, Kinesiology/Exercise Science, Information Technology, Health Professions, Engineering, Earth Science/Geology, Dental Studies, Computer Science, Chemistry, Biology, Astronomy/Astrophysics

Title: RISE Germany
Description: RISE Germany offers undergraduate students from North American and British universities the opportunity to complete a summer research internship at top German universities and research institutions.
Fields of study: Pre-Medicine, Biology, Chemistry, Astronomy/Astrophysics, Physics, Earth Science/Geology, Engineering

Title: Goldwater Scholarship
Description: The Barry Goldwater Scholarship and Excellence in Education Program aims to provide a continuing source of highly qualified scientists, mathematicians and engineers by awarding scholarships to college students pursuing research in these fields.
Fields of study: Astronomy/Astrophysics, Biology, Chemistry, Computer Science, Earth Science/Geology, Engineering, Information Technology, Mathematics/Statistics, Physics, Pre-Medicine

Title: Pennsylvania Space Grant Consortium Undergraduate Scholarship
Description: The Pennsylvania Space Grant Consortium will award one-year scholarships in the amount of $4,000 per academic year to outstanding students across the state of Pennsylvania who promote undergraduate study in the fields of science, technology, engineering and mathematics (STEM) and are likely to pursue a career in an are of interest to NASA.
Fields of study: Pre-Medicine, Biology, Chemistry, Computer Science, Dental Studies, Earth Science/Geology, Engineering, Health Professions, Information Technology, Kinesiology/Exercise Science, Mathematics/Statistics, Nursing, Nutritional Science, Astronomy/Astrophysics, Physics, Psychology, Veterinary Studies

Title: Edward D. Hendrickson / SAE Engineering Scholarship
Description: This scholarship, established by Hendrickson International, honors the late Edward D. Hendrickson, a pioneer in the commercial vehicle industry.
Fields of study: Engineering, Information Technology, Earth Science/Geology, Astronomy/Astrophysics, Physics, Pre-Medicine, Biology, Chemistry, Computer Science

Title: Herbert Levy Memorial Scholarship
Description: The purpose of the Society of Physics Students scholarship program is to encourage the study of physics and the pursuit of high scholarship. In memory of her late husband Dr. Herbert Levy, Margaret Sussman Levy bequeathed funds to establish this scholarship award "to be used for a worthy, needy physics student" to attain a quality physics education. The award consists of a $2,000 scholarship.

Title: Honeywell Scholarship
Description: This scholarship provides aid for current freshmen who are pursuing a STEM degree at a Honeywell Partner School or Horatio Alger Collegiate Partner institution.
Fields of study: Agriculture, Astronomy/Astrophysics, Biology, Chemistry, Computer Science, Earth Science/Geology, Engineering, Information Technology, Physics, Pre-Medicine, Psychology

Title: TMC / SAE Donald D. Dawson Technical Scholarship
Description: SAE and The Maintenance Council of American Trucking Associations have established this technical education scholarship to honor the leadership of Donald D. Dawson. From his position as Vice President of Maintenance with Roadway Express, Mr. Dawson worked through SAE and TMC to merge the goals of truck equipment users and manufacturers.
Fields of study: Engineering, Information Technology, Earth Science/Geology, Astronomy/Astrophysics, Physics, Pre-Medicine, Biology, Chemistry, Computer Science

Title: Nick Anderson Astronomy Scholarship
Description: Must take an Astronomy course in one of Virginia Beach's high schools as a junior or senior.

Title: Van Nattan-Hansen Scholarship
Description: The DAS Van Nattan Hansen Scholarship program provides support for worthy graduating high school students or undergraduate college students majoring in astronomy and the physical sciences.

Title: Texas A&M Science and Mathematics Scholarships
Description: Texas A&M University provides various scholarships to students majoring in Biology, Chemistry, Mathematics, Physics, Astronomy, and other sciences. These scholarships are based on various factors.
Fields of study: Pre-Medicine, Physics, Mathematics/Statistics, Chemistry, Biology, Astronomy/Astrophysics

Title: Universities Space Research Association Scholarship Awards
Description: The USRA Scholarship Awards provide college scholarship awards to students who have shown a career interest in science or engineering with an emphasis on space research or space science education.
Fields of study: Veterinary Studies, Psychology, Pre-Medicine, Physics, Nutritional Science, Nursing, Mathematics/Statistics, Kinesiology/Exercise Science, Information Technology, Health Professions, Engineering, Earth Science/Geology, Dental Studies, Computer Science, Chemistry, Biology, Astronomy/Astrophysics

Title: Clarkston Scholars Program
Description: Each year, the Clarkston Scholars Program provides one sophomore attending a four-year college or university undergraduate program in Pennsylvania, majoring in a life sciences related field of study, a $10,000 scholarship award ($5,000 per year for junior and senior year). In addition, the Clarkston Scholar will receive exposure to the life sciences industry through mentoring with Clarkston Consulting and participation in Pennsylvania Bio events over the course of the two-year scholarship award period.

Title: ACIL Scholarship
Description: The ACIL Scholarship Alliance, a division of the Independent Laboratories Institute, helps to ensure future generations of skilled employees for the laboratory testing community. Finding and keeping qualified technical personnel is a constant challenge for our industry.

Title: Providian Medical Scholarship
Description: Providian Medical, a leading company in the sales and service of new and refurbished ultrasound, MRI, and CT medical equipment, is continuing its annual "Providian Medical Scholarship" in an effort to reward hard working students across the country. At Providian Medical, we believe that education is key for anyone preparing to enter the workplace and embark on a career. To that end, we hope to play a small part in helping students achieve their educational goals with this bi-annual $500 scholarship.

Title: Francenia E. Fisher Scholarship
Description: A scholarship of up to $2,500 awarded annually to an outstanding senior biological science major specializing in botany. This scholarship is intended to encourage talented undergraduates to pursue careers in plant biology. Selection criteria include academic excellence, competence in plant biology, and demonstrated interest in a career in the plant sciences.

Title: Central Michigan University Biology Scholarships
Description: This scholarship is used to provide awards to incoming freshmen who intend to major in biology and who have outstanding high school academic backgrounds.

Title: Kent State Biological Sciences Scholarships
Description: Every year, the Department of Biological Sciences offers in scholarships and awards to recognize our biology major's achievements in academia. Please watch for announcements for the call of applications at the beginning of the fall semester.

Title: Undergraduate Biology Scholarships @ IUPUI
Description: Indiana University - Purdue University Indianapolis provides a wide range of scholarships for outstanding biology majors in all years of study.

Title: Universities Space Research Association Scholarship Awards
Description: The USRA Scholarship Awards provide college scholarship awards to students who have shown a career interest in science or engineering with an emphasis on space research or space science education.
Fields of study: Veterinary Studies, Psychology, Pre-Medicine, Physics, Nutritional Science, Nursing, Mathematics/Statistics, Kinesiology/Exercise Science, Information Technology, Health Professions, Engineering, Earth Science/Geology, Dental Studies, Computer Science, Chemistry, Biology, Astronomy/Astrophysics

Title: University of Houston Biology & Biochemistry Scholarships
Description: University of Houston provides various scholarships for support of the study of biology and biochemistry by outstanding students.

Title: University of Memphis Undergraduate Biology Scholarships
Description: Undergraduate biology students at the University of Memphis with various specific subject interests are eligible for many scholarships.

Title: University of Missouri Biology Scholarships
Description: The Division of Biological Sciences recognizes academic achievement with a number of endowed awards and scholarships.

Title: Varina Vaughn - Winona Jordan Scholarship
Description: Scholarship of up to $1,000 awarded annually to an outstanding upper-division biological science major who intends to pursue a career in the plant sciences.

Title: Western Michigan University Biological Sciences Scholarships
Description: Students at Western Michigan University are often recognized for outstanding work in the Department of Biological Sciences. Scholarships and awards vary in size, qualifications and application process.

Title: GEICO Achievement Awards
Description: This long-standing GEICO tradition supports some of our country's most outstanding college students by providing $2,500 awards, and recognizing their dedication to academic success, leadership and community service.
Fields of study: Business/Management, Computer Science, Economics, Information Technology, Marketing, Mathematics/Statistics, Sports Management

Title: North American Van Lines Logistics Scholarship
Description: North American Van Lines, one of the leading moving companies in the United States, is committed to supporting the community as well as the growth and development of the moving services and logistics industries. Five lucky qualified entrants will each win a $1,000 scholarship towards their degree in logistics or supply chain management at the college or university of their choice.

Title: NSHSS Foundation Business/Public Policy Scholarship
Description: High school seniors with a minimum GPA of 3.0 and demonstrated desire to major in business, economics, or public policy are eligible. Requirements include personal statement, list of related activities, photo, transcript, and educator recommendation. **Note to applicants: A transcript, resume, essay, and photo must be submitted for all NSHSS Foundation scholarships. (The Business/Public Policy Scholarship requires a list of business-related experiences in lieu of a resume). One educator recommendation will be applied to all NSHSS Foundation scholarships.

Title: Berbay Scholarship Program
Description: Berbay Marketing & Public Relations endows a $1,000 scholarship to a marketing, public relations or communications student who demonstrates a high level of writing skill, academic excellence and creativity. This scholarship is awarded annually to a single student in order to help support their education for a professional career in the field.

Title: GMR Web Team Marketing Scholarship Program
Description: All applicants must be currently enrolled as an undergraduate at a university, and must be pursuing a marketing degree or a business degree with an emphasis in marketing. Applicants are required to use their college email address (.edu) when registering for the scholarship.

Title: Herman F.A. Lange Scholarship
Description: Must have a Major in Parks, Recreation, Tourism, Sports Management, or Leisure Service.

Title: HubShout Internet Marketing Scholarship
Description: HubShout is pleased to be supporting the next generation of Internet Marketing professionals. In the SEO Reseller space for the better part of a decade, we feel it is important to give back. The scholarship is open to students with at least one year of college. They must also have a minimum of 3.0 GPA to apply. A scholarship award of $1,000 (each) is awarded to the strongest candidate with a demonstrated passion for Internet Marketing.

Title: Jane M. Klausman Women in Business Scholarship
Description: The program operates at the Zonta club, district/region and international levels. Zonta annually awards up to 32 scholarships of US$1,000 each at the district/region level and 12 international scholarships in the amount of US$7,000 each.

Title: Mendez Scholarships
Description: Mendez Scholarships Non-Profit provides scholarships for outstanding servant-leader junior and senior students studying engineering, pharmacy, or business.

Title: Pitt Business Scholarships
Description: The University of Pittsburgh offers many scholarships for business and management undergraduate students.

Title: The LAGRANT Foundation Graduate Scholarship
Description: The scholarship recipients will receive a trip to Atlanta where they will participate in career building activities. This includes a welcome dinner with a keynote speaker, two day-long career development workshops and a scholarship & donor recognition reception. During these activities, students will have the opportunity to meet industry professionals, network and gain exposure to the advertising, marketing and public relations world. TLF accepts applications from undergraduate students (current freshmen, sophomores, juniors and non-graduating seniors ONLY) and graduate students.

Title: The LAGRANT Foundation Undergraduate Scholarship
Description: The scholarship recipients will receive a trip to Atlanta where they will participate in career building activities. This includes a welcome dinner with a keynote speaker, two day-long career development workshops and a scholarship & donor recognition reception. During these activities, students will have the opportunity to meet industry professionals, network and gain exposure to the advertising, marketing and public relations world.
